loans.name: Mukhtar

texts.en:
Mukhtar is a farmer with 11 years experience in breeding livestock. The main scope of his work is selling milk products. He is married and has two sons aged 19 and 20 years. Mukhtar would like to develop his business, so that this business gives a good income and security for his children. 

With the loan received, he plans to purchase livestock with its calf. He thanks VFAC and Kiva in advance for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase livestock with its calf.

loans.name: Naba Al-Hayah Group

texts.en: This group is called Naba Al-Hayah and it is made up of four women who live in Taiz, Yemen. Halima is 30 years old, married and works hard at her job as a tailor. She is a professional and her work has attracted many customers. She is requesting a youth loan for 50,000 YER from AMB to buy a sewing machine that works well and will allow her to meet her clients' needs.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of hair extensions, hair weaves and beauty products.

loans.name: Celina

texts.es:
Celina, de 52 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, además de ser alegre y cordial. Es viuda del  padre de sus hijos quienes ya son independientes, por quienes se esforzó en sacar adelante a pesar de la adversidad. Vive  cómodamente instalada en su propia casa que compró con el fruto de sus esfuerzos, en compañía de sus inquilinos.
La actividad que realiza Celina es la venta de hojas secas de hirapay que es una palmera amazónica, estas hojas son usadas para el techado de las casas, las cuales almacena en su casa y los vende en la vía pública en un espacio  en la vereda de la pista transitada, sus clientes la visitan buscando estas hojas que tienen gran demanda y la buena atención que les brinda.
Se inició hace más de 01 año con un préstamo particular y hasta el momento cuenta con la ayuda de sus hijos y una persona que paga por semana.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja.
Por otro lado cuenta  que decidió empezar esta actividad por idea de su socio quien se encarga de la extracción de estas hojas desde el interior de la selva, además vio que dejaba mayor ganancias.
Por tanto, ahora viendo los buenos resultados, tiene planes de continuar y aumentar su inversión en el negocio. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 06 con la institución MFP. Por tanto cuenta  con  su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más de cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores crédito que tuvo. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal por considerarlo un grupo unido y solidario
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, los invertirá en su totalidad en la extracción de las hojas de hirapay, buscando minimizar gastos y lograr sacar la mayor cantidad posible de hojas, para así tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Celina, who is 52, is a hardworking and determined woman with a strong desire to succeed.  What is more, she is cheerful and friendly.  She is a widow and the children she had with her late husband are now independent.  It was for their sake that she strove to succeed in the face of adversity and it was the fruits of these efforts which enabled her to buy her own home, where she lives comfortably along with her tenants.

Celina's business is selling dried hirapay (an Amazonian palm) leaves which are used for roofing houses.  She stores them in her house and sells them in the street on the pavement of the busy road.  Her customers visit her to obtain these leaves, which are in great demand, and because of the good service which she provides.  She set up her business over a year ago with a personal loan and, so far, has been able to rely on the help of her children and one other person whom she pays weekly.  She considers her business to be quite profitable on account of the earnings which it brings in.  Furthermore, she says that she got the idea of starting the business from her partner, who organises the harvesting of the leaves from the rain forest, and saw that it made higher profits.

Now, therefore, having seen the good results she has achieved, she plans to continue and increase her investment in the business.  This will involve obtaining a sixth loan from MFP, whose support she believes she can count on to pursue her goals.  What is more, she is once again committed to making all her repayments, as she did in the case of her previous loans.  She is happy with her communal bank which she considers to be a unified and caring group.  The 1,000 nuevos soles which she is applying for will be used in its entirety to harvest hirapay leaves, whilst minimising costs and attempting to harvest the greatest quantity of leaves possible, and thereby make higher profits.

loans.use: to buy hirapay leaves

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol de 30 años es natural de Santa Rosa comparte una vida conyugal con Misael de 32 años, como producto de su vida marital tiene hoy a  sus dos hijos Milena y Juan.
Gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo constante logro junto a Misael adquirir una vivienda a base de madera. Luego de culminar sus estudios como enfermera fuera de su localidad decidió retornar a su natal Santa Rosa con el objetivo de servir a su gente, es por ello que desde hace 7 años viene laborando el centro de salud público haciendo honor a su vocación de servicio y siendo una participe del desarrollo social de su localidad.
Al ser una persona muy dedicada a su labor apoya ocasionalmente también en centros y policlínicos particulares de su localidad logrando obtener así generar ingresos adicionales para su economía familiar.
Haciendo caso de su instinto micro-empresarial a optado por ingresar al rubro comercial consistente en la venta de calzados por catálogo que planea ofrecerlos a los empleados y trabajadores particulares con quien tiene constante contacto, es por ello que para desea contar con capital de trabajo que le permite adquirir el primer lote de calzados y la compra de los catálogos, esperando así obtener ingresos adicionales.
Tiene el deseo de a futuro aperturar una farmacia en la cual pueda seguir desempeñando su labor como protectora de la salud social y así consolidarse para brindarle a sus pequeños un mejor futuro. Lleva consigo 3 créditos. Gracias a su labor abnegada cuenta con un gran empleo que le permite obtener un ingreso fijo mensual  y cumplir de manera fluida con el pago de sus cuotas. Se siente muy comprometida con el trabajo que vienen desarrollando sus compañeros de su banco comunal puesto que siente mucha confianza.
Con los 1,500 nuevos soles incursionará en la venta de calzados por catálogo realizando la compra de un lote de calzados y los respectivos catálogos.
texts.en: Marisol is thirty years old and comes from Santa Rosa. She lives in a civil union with Misael, who is thirty-two. They have two children, Milena and Juan. Thanks to her constant efforts, together with her husband, Marisol managed to buy a house made of wood. After graduating as a nurse in the city, she decided to come back to her hometown in order to help people. She has been working at the public health centre in Santa Rosa for seven years, honouring her promise to herself by being an active participant in her town's social development. As she is very dedicated to her work, she also helps sometimes at private health centres and clinics of her area, which helps her generate more income, which goes toward household expenses. Following her business instincts, she decided to start selling shoes from a catalogue. Her idea is to sell them to colleagues and to the other professionals she works with on a regular basis. In order to do that, she wants working capital with which to buy the first bulk of shoes as well as the catalogues, an activity that would generate additional income. In the future, Marisol would like to open a pharmacy, in order to keep helping people protect their health while generating more income to give her little ones a brighter future. This would be her fourth loan. Her sparing no efforts means that her position is stable and that she can count on her monthly salary to reimburse her loans seamlessly. Marisol feels a strong bond with the other members of her communal bank and says that everyone trusts each other. With this loan, she will buy shoes to sell from a catalogue and start her business in this field.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Jacqueline Patricia

texts.es:
Jacqueline 29 años de edad, originaria de Managua, casada, madre de 1 hijo de 5 años, el cual cursa el preescolar de primaria, de oficio comerciante. Actualmente es dueña de un Cyber. Ella  inicio  su negocio atraves de una idea que le dio su esposo de comprar unas computadoras que estaban vendiendo en oferta, ya que el dueño del Cyber se iba del país, por eso la estaba vendiendo y fue ahí que aprovecharon la oportunidad de comenzar con su propio  negocio, del que es dueña desde hace 5 años, este ha sido su primer negocio.
Sus expectativas es ampliar su negocio  y agregar otros productos que le  gustaría vender. 

Ademas de comprar computadoras, ella quiere comprar  otros productos adicionales para agregar a su negocio,   como perfumes, celulares y joyas de plata, etc. De esta manera poder  diversificar su negocio. Ya que ella estima que el préstamo le  ayudaría a superar sus ventas, y con las ganancias que obtenga invertir en otros productos que aun no tiene en inventario. Sus planes futuros es cambiar sus computadoras, para brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jacqueline, 29, was born in Managua, is married, and is a merchant and mother of a 5-year-old son who attends preschool. She owns an Internet café Cyber, a business she started after her husband suggested she buy some computers that were on sale after the owner of Cyber left the country. She took that opportunity five years ago to start her first business. She expects to grow the business and add other items to sell.

In addition to buying computers, she wants to to buy more items such as perfumes, cell phones, and silver jewelry to sell so that she can diversify her business. She believes the loan will help her increase sales, and with the profits, she will invest in more items that she currently does not stock. She also plans to replace her computers to give offer her customers good service.

loans.use: to buy more items such as perfumes, cell phones, and silver jewelry.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena sells ladies' wear and children’s wear, which she has done for 4 years. She has 4 children and is married to a mason. She uses her to income to support her husband in paying their accommodation and utility bills. Abena needs this loan to purchase more ladies' wear and children’s wear for sale. With the new profit from her expanded business, Abena will acquire a shop for the sale of her clothes.

loans.use: to purchase more ladies' wear and children’s wear for sale

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en: Cynthia sells cassava, plantain and vegetables at Besease, near Elmina. She has done this for three years. Cynthia is married to a mason and has five dependents. Cynthia uses her income to assist her husband in the upkeep of their family. She will use her loan to purchase more cassava, plantain and vegetables for sale. Cynthia will expand her business with her new profit.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava, plantain and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy stationary and construction tools for her business.

loans.name: Vision Group

texts.en:
This group consists of two members, Ogbedei and Odoley, who both sell fish in the community. 

Ogbedei is a 30-year-old fish seller who is married to Adjei, a thirty-seven-year-old mason, and they both have three children. She has been with ID Ghana for the past two years and she seems to be doing very good. She has been in this business activity for 12 years now. She hawks from Mondays to Saturdays. Some of the fish is displayed in the photograph. 

This is her 6th loan and the needed loan amount of 850 GHS is to buy more fish to sell to her customers. She has been able, through her business and with the help of her husband, to provide their children with quality education. She gives the praise of her success to when she joined ID Ghana. 

They need a total amount of 1,450 GHS to buy more fish to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Enkhjargal

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhjargal, 43 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He has been running a transportation business since 2008.

Before rendering a transportation service, he had been selling protein-powered noodles but due to intense competition, he stopped this business. His wife has been a saleswoman at her sister’s counter but recently began her own business which includes selling gloves, hats and scarves.

In order to increase the current assets of his wife’s business, he is requesting the loan of 1,500,000 MNT to buy the above mentioned goods. By doing so, the family can generate more income, thus improving their living standard and invest in their children’s education without worry.

loans.use: to purchase gloves, hats and scarves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics and hair relaxers to sell.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a 33-year-old married woman with two children who lives in Masindi ,Uganda. For six years, she has been selling clothes. With the income earned she has been able to pay school fees for her children and renovate her house. Price fluctuations and ever-changing customer preferences hinder her business. Her dream is to own a boutique. Her personal goal is to educate her children up to the university. Jackline is requesting for a loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en: Constance sells second-hand ladies' and children's dresses. She has been in this business for some years now. Constance is married with six children.   She uses her income to support her husband pay utility and accommodation bills. Constance needs this loan to purchase more second-hand ladies' and children's dresses to sell. With the new profit, Constance plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more second-hand ladies' and children's dresses to sell.

loans.name: Shpetim

texts.en:
Shpetim is 25 years old, engaged to be married and lives in the Northern part of Kosovo. Shpetim is a musician who performs at weddings and other family celebrations. He and his brother have been involved in this business for more than three years. He considers his business to be very profitable. He is very busy during the summertime when lots of Kosvars celebrate weddings and require entertainment for other types of celebrations. 
He works a lot during that time in order to save money for the winter when business is much slower. Shpetim is now requesting a loan to buy a sound system, which he will use for his performances. The loan will help him to have better equipment so that he can earn more income.
He hopes in the future to buy new musical instruments, which will allow him to improve the quality of his music. His goal is to save money for his future and to get married. 
He thanks all Kiva lenders for their support!

loans.use: to buy a sound system for his performances.

loans.name: Trevenia

texts.en: Trevenia, 33, is married and lives in the Paynesville South community. She is a mother of three children between the ages of 4 and 19. All of her children are attending school. Her husband is a business man. For the past nine years she has been operating a provision shop, where she sells beans, vita, bath soap, hair grease, biscuits, sardines, lunch meat, bread, soft drinks, and many other items. Trevenia learned to sell from her mother. Her shop is open from 6 am to 10 pm. She makes a profit when she sells, because she has what her customers need and she is always at their service. With the profit generated from the business, she buys more goods to sell. She buys from wholesale dealers and transports her goods by commercial vehicle. She is requesting this loan to purchase more bath soap, biscuits, soft drinks, sardines, beans, and hair grease for the business. Her plan for the future is to give her children a good education and to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more bath soap, biscuits, soft drinks, sardines, beans, and hair grease for her shop

loans.name: Lazar

texts.en:
Lazar is a single male who lives in a minority community in a southern part of Kosovo. He is planning to start his own business in agriculture. Lazar has had a lot of experience working on his land for many years.
He is planning to buy tractor and other tools to start his business working on the land of others. In this way, according to him, he can earn a lot of income. In his village there is a very big demand for people to work on the land with a tractor and they always pay for this service. Now Lazar is requesting a loan in order to buy a tractor. The loan will help him to start his business, which will allow him to earn an income for living expenses. He hopes in the future to expand his business to buy more tractors and to hire employees to work for him. His goal is to save money for his future and to get married. He wants to thank all Kiva lenders who are helping him to start his business!

loans.use: to buy a tractor.

loans.name: Cheick Oumar

texts.fr:
Âgé de plus 26 ans, Monsieur Cheick Oumar est célibataire et résidant chez son père dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Cheick Oumar n’a pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école, il s’est très vite initié depuis plus de dix années à la vente des pièces détachée auto  auprès de son frère à Sikasso. Sa boutique se située au nouveau marché de médine Sikasso et la plupart de sa clientèle est composée d’hommes surtout les forains. Avec une telle expérience dans le domaine, il jouit d’une parfaite confiance de sa clientèle. Il achète des marchandises à Lomé (république de Togo) et  afin de les revendre aux garagiste et particuliers de Sikasso. Dans les souci de mieux satisfaire des commandes de plus en plus croissantes, il sollicite ainsi ce premier crédit auprès de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. 
Ce premier crédit lui permettra d’acheter 10 paires enjoliver, 5 paires de coussin et 20 jantes.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 200 000 F CFA. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses personnelles, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son magasin.
texts.en:
More than 26 years old, Mister Cheick Oumar is single and lives with his father in a large traditional family in Hamdallaye, one of the popular neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the republic of Mali).

Mister Cheick Oumar didn't have the chance to progress in school, he very quickly learned the sale of automobile spare parts from his brother in Sikasso more than ten years ago. His shop is located at the new market of Médine Sikasso and most of his clientèle consists of men especially foreigners. With such experience in this domain, he enjoys perfect confidence from his clientèle. He buys his merchandise in Lomé (republic of Togo) and then resells it to the garage owners and individuals of Sikasso. Concerned about better satisfying the orders which are growing more and more, he is thus requesting this first loan from the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso.

This first loan will allow him to buy 10 pairs of hubcaps, 5 pairs of cushions and 20 wheel rims.

With this loan, he envisions making a monthly profit of 200,000 FCFA. With the profits made, he plans to settle his essential personal expenses, contribute to the family expenses, pay the interest on his loan and invest the rest in his shop.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: German Nicolas

texts.es:
GERMAN NICOLAS tiene 21 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA VICTORIA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

GERMAN NICOLAS se dedica a la agricultura a las siembras de maíz, arroz. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. Solicita el crédito para comprar insecticidas, urea, líquido mata monte, fertilizantes. Con la ayuda del crédito estará dispuesto a trabajar y cambiar el estilo de vida.

El sueño es hacerce una casa con jardín. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades, plagas en el cultivo.

En el tiempo libre le gusta cuidar los cultivos.
texts.en:
German Nicolas is 21 years old and single with no children. He lives with his parents in the city of Ventanas, Provincia de los Rios [Province of the Rivers]. 

He is a member of VRC LA VICTORIA, located in the Pantano district and part of the canton Ventanas which is dedicated to agricultural and livestock activities.

German Nicolas makes a living in agriculture growing rice and corn. He makes purchases in the city of Ventanas. He requests the loan to buy insecticides, urea, Mata Monte liquid [an herbicide], and fertilizers. With the help of the loan he will be able to work and change his style of life. 

His dream is to build himself a house with a garden. The challenges which he faces are crop diseases and plagues. 

In his free time, he likes to take care of his farm.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, urea, herbicide, and fertilizers

loans.name: Julia Maritza

texts.es:
Doña  Julia, tiene 56 años de edad, originaria de Managua, tiene 3 hijos el cual unas de ella esta cursando  su carrera universitaria de administración de empresas, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa usada. Inicio hace 10 años vendiendo ropa usada, pues su deseo de superación le ayudo a seguir adelante  vendiendo otros productos adicionales como fresco, frijoles, etc. Hoy en día cuenta con 10 años de  tener su venta de ropa fija, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de su hija, sus expectativas es diversificarse en productos para su negocio.
Julia solicita el crédito para comprar  ropa usada como pantalones, faldas, blusas, etc. Todos los productos  mas solicitados por sus  clientes, ella estima que le ayudaría a incrementar sus ventas, mejorando a su vez las ganancias, sus planes futuros es iniciar una pulpería para que le genere mejores  ingresos, ya que es algo que le va ayudar a salir adelante con su familia, sus metas próximas es invertir mas en su negocio comprando mas ropa para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Julia is 56 years old, originally from Managua, and has three children, one of whom is completing a university degree in business administration. She is in the commercial trade, and makes a living through the sale of used clothing. She began selling used clothing 10 years ago. Her desire to excel helped her to go forward selling other products such as soft drinks, beans, etc.

Today she counts 10 years of having her used clothing business. In her business she receives the support of her daughter. Her hope is to diversify the products for her business. 

Julia requests the loan to buy used clothing such as pants, skirts, blouses, etc., all products that are most requested by her customers. She thinks that these products will help her increase her sales, at the same time improving her earnings. 

Her future plan is to start a juice stand in order to generate more income, since it is something that will help her family get ahead. Her next goals are to invest more in her business, buying more clothes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy used clothes such as pants, skirts, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Rober

texts.es:
Con 26 años de edad Rober es un joven muy emprendedor y de muchos objetivos a largo plazo. Tiene por pareja a Corina de 23 años quien es su compañera de vida y desea formar un lindo hogar ya que por el momento no tienen hijos, gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo en conjunto a logrado culminar el primer piso de una vivienda  a base de material noble. Como parte de una herencia inmaterial por parte de sus padres logró aprender desde muy niño las diversas actividades del mundo agrícola, especialmente en la producción de cacao orgánico. Posteriormente opto por independizarse logrando adquirir unas parcelas desde hace 11 años en donde hasta hoy con el apoyo de Corina ha logrado convertirlo en el principal sustento económico de su familia.
Para lograr obtener buenas ganancias gracias a este gran producto debe dedicarse de lleno a las tareas de producción el cual parte desde el deshierbo de maleza, fermentado y secado, siendo uno de los mas importantes el deshierbo para evitar así la competencia entre mala hierba y nutrientes que poseen los suelos, adicional a ello es necesario realizar una pequeña evaluación de los suelos en general para seleccionar el tipo de abono orgánico a emplearse, siendo el guano de isla uno de los mejores y mas acoplables a los diversos tipos de suelos en la región.
Por tratarse de un área considerable desea por inicio de campaña contar con la mano de obra por parte de los jornaleros del lugar quienes posteriormente emplearán el abono orgánico para así garantizar una producción de calidad. 
Sus objetivos a largo plazo apuntan en reunir capital suficiente  y tener un futuro con muchas oportunidades para sus futuros hijos, espera con esa motivación seguir adelante y trabajar con el mismo empuje que lo caracteriza. Con los 1,500 nuevos soles que solicita, realizará un mantenimiento consistente  el deshierbo con apoyo de jornaleros del lugar , así como la compra de sacos con guano de ave como abono orgánico para garantizar una producción de calidad.
texts.en:
At 26 Rober is an enterprising young man with long-term goals. His life partner Corina is 23, and he wants to start a home, though he does not have children now. Thanks to their hard work, they have completed the first floor of their house with good materials. As a child, his parents taught him how to farm and, in particular, to grow organic cacao. Later, he decided to farm on his own, and 11 years ago he acquired land that he now works with Corina and is the main source of their income. 

To increase their earnings, they have focused on producing cacao: removing weeds and fermenting and drying it. Weed removal is the most important task, since it is critical to keep the weeds from absorbing the nutrients in the soil. Evaluating the soil to determine the best organic fertilizer to use is necessary, and island bird guano is one of the best suited to the regional soils. Since Rober has a large area to cultivate, he wants to hire day laborers, and he will also spread organic fertilizer to ensure a quality crop. 

In order to meet his goals and provide a brighter future for his children, Rober needs working capital. With this motivation, he expects to get ahead and continue to work hard. The 1,500 nuevos soles he has requested will be used to removed weeds with the help of the day workers and to buy sacks of organic bird fertilizer to ensure a quality crop.

loans.use: to hire day laborers and to buy sacks of organic bird fertilizer.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua sells cassava, plantain and vegetables at Besease near Elmina. She has done this for 5 years now. Efua is married to a mason and has 5 dependents. Efua uses her income to assists her husband in the upkeep of their family.

She will use her loan to purchase more cassava, plantain and vegetables for sale. Efua will expand her business with her new profit.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava, plantain and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Bash Group

texts.en:
The group consists of two partners, namely Georgina and Margaret, both residing at Teshie.  They have been a group for two years now and are doing very well. 

Georgina is a 37-year-old trader who deals in jewelry, gari (fried cassava paste) and pure water. This has been her work for the past 8 years and she still is doing very well. With the gari (fried cassava paste), she goes to Ada (Greater Accra Region) for it, while she travels to Benin for the jewelry. Because of her integrity and frankness, all her customers have her at heart. 

She has been with ID Ghana for the past two years and still loves to be part of us for all her life. She has taken 5 loans and has fully repaid all.  On her 6th loan, she needs 1,900 GHS to help her meet her customers' demand.

They need an amount of 2,250 GHS to buy more goods to sell to their respective customers in and around Teshie.

loans.use: to buy more and sell to customers

loans.name: Selim

texts.en:
Selim is 30 years old, married and is a father of two children. Selim works as a security guard in a factory, earning a very low salary. To earn more income for his living expenses, he also has his own business selling wood and providing transportation. He has been running this business for more than five years now. Selim considers his business very profitable.  
He sells and transports the wood with his truck to different places in Kosovo, depending on the demand of the customers. Selim is now requesting a loan to repair his truck’s engine and to buy new tires. The loan will help him to continue his business. He hopes in the future to continue his business and expand it even further. His goal is to improve the conditions for his family. He wants to thank all Kiva lenders for helping him in his business.

loans.use: To repair his truck’s engine and to buy new tires.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is 28 years old. He lives with his father, brother and grandmother, in a small village of Gardabani district, East Georgia. His father and grandmother are provided with retirement pensions. George is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has two milk cows, whose milk is used in dairy production. They produce yogurt and cheese to sell locally, in an open market, at a good price. Besides that, George has a hectare of land, where maize is grown. George is a very hard-working man and does his best to ensure a good harvest. George requested a loan for cultivating the land. After land is cultivated properly, he will be able to sow maize. He will sell the harvested maize locally, at a good price. This will increase the income of the family and they will improve their living conditions. George awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for cultivating the land so he can sow maize

loans.name: Igball

texts.en:
Igball is sixty years old. She is married and the mother of six children, three boys and three girls. She lives in a southern part of Kosovo. Igball has been a seamstress for many years and has been running her own business for just as long. She is very professional, and she is always busy with a lot of orders.  As a result of having so many years of experience in her profession, she has lots of customers who are very happy with her.  In addition to her business, her son sells clothing and other items she makes, in a market. She mainly serves customers in her area, but she also has customers from different cities in Kosovo.

Igball is requesting a loan in order to buy materials for her work. The loan will help her to get more customers, because she can provide more and better selections for her customers. She hope in the future to continue working in her business. Her goal is to save money for the future. She wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To buy materials for her work as a seamstress

loans.name: Cha Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of two members, Evelyn and Grace. They have been together from 2011 to date. 

Evelyn is a 49-year-old, single parent. She has been with ID Ghana for the past one year and is doing very well with her business and family. She has been a hairdresser for seven years. She used to do her business in the house from Mondays through Saturdays, but with consistent savings with ID Ghana, she was able to raise enough money to build a store, where she now serves her customers. She is grateful to ID Ghana for the training on savings, which motivated her to save to achieve her dream. 

This is Evelyn's third loan, and she needed GHS 750 to buy more creams, shampoos, and wigs to sell to her customers. She has been able to educate her child to the Senior High School level, with her profits from the business. 

Evelyn and Grace need a total amount of GHS 1,500 to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: To buy beauty salon supplies, to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Zviadi

texts.en: Zviadi is 29 years old and lives with his wife, two infant children, father and grandmother in the Abasha distict of West Georgia. He is a car mechanic and his father is the driver of a first aid car, and they both work for a monthly salary. His grandmother has a retirement pension. The family also runs an agricultural business which includes two milk cows whose milk they use to make cheese. They sell about 15-20 kg of this cheese each month to people who live nearby. They also have two pigs and sell their piglets locally. Zviadi is a very hard-working man and has a lot of experience in his business. He is requesting a loan to buy calves to raise so he can expand his dairy farm. This will increase the family's income and allow them to improve their living conditions. Zviadi is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy calves for a dairy farm.

loans.name: Ding Group

texts.en: This loan group is made up of two people, Sylvia and Joyce. They created the group last year. Joyce earns a living by selling rice and oil while Sylvia is a 34-year-old trader and a single parent. She has been with ID Ghana for one year, and has earned a living for the last nine years by selling cosmetics. She does her selling from Mondays to Saturdays, and from 7:00 am to 6:00 pm. Thanks to her savings, she was able to rent the store where she now sells her goods. This is her third loan and she is requesting GHS 700 to buy more cosmetics to sell to her customers. This business will allow her to pay for the education of her only child. The total loan request is for GHS 1,700 and both women want to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Temuri

texts.en: Temuri lives in Ozurgeti District. He is 38 years old, married, and lives with his wife, mother, and three children who go to the local school. Temuri is, at the moment, unemployed. The only source for the family is agricultural land, where they grow nuts and maize. They sell the harvested products seasonally. Besides this, Temuri’s mother is involved in the trading business and sells gifts and toys in the local district. Temuri decided to start his business as their existing income isn’t enough for the family and their living conditions are poor. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative with Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to country rural poor who do not have access to credit products and are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Temuri will purchase a car and provide taxi services to local people. The family's income will increase and they will be able to improve the living conditions of the family. Along with the above-mentioned, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market, in case of need.

loans.use: to purchase a car for use as a taxi

loans.name: Jumberi

texts.en:
Jumberi is 61 years old and lives in the Chokhatauri District with his wife Julieta. He has asked for several loans from local financial institutions for his start-up business but without any success because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income the family has is the small monthly salary Julieta earns by working as a teacher at the village school. The family earns a total of 150 GEL per month, which is barely enough to provide food for a two-preson family. According to Credo, the family belongs in the subsistence poor category. 

Jumberi is requesting a loan from Credo to re-start a family business which he had to stop due to financial problems. He will use his loan to buy rabbits and begin working in animal husbandry. He will buy cages for rabbits to live in and sell their meat, which is in high demand locally. Jumberi's loan request was reviewed within the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program helps people begin businesses with convenient credit terms that are ideal for the rural poor who do not have access to the usual sources of credit. Jumberi believes that his new business, financed with this Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to start an animal-husbandry business.

loans.name: Cruz Jaime

texts.es: Cruz Jaime de cincuenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida  y su hija en casa propia. El posee un taller de mecánica automotriz tiene varios años con el negocio y posee mucha experiencia valiosa que le permite realizar bien su trabajo y al mimo tiempo obtiene muy buenas ganancias, el negocio esta ubicado en un lugar muy estratégico que califico como excelente para sus actividades mecánicas, tiene mucha clientela y últimamente ha aumentado la demanda pues todo  lo realiza de primera calidad y  a precios accesibles, además el servicio es excelente siempre recibe a las personas con una enorme sonrisa en el rostro; Cruz es un hombre trabajador dispuesto a salir adelante y triunfar, tiene muchas metas por alcanzar, una de ellas es ver crecer su negocio para mantenerse adelante de la competencia, piensa que los campeones no se hacen en gimnasios, están hechos de algo inmaterial que tienen muy dentro de ellos, es un deseo, un sueño, una visión, pensando así es como se decido a solicitarle a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar herramientas, repuestos, etc. Cruz Jaime tiene buenas referencias de pago y una moral intachable asegura saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la certeza que así podrá llevar seguridad económica a su hogar.
texts.en:
Cruz Jaime, 53, lives with his life partner and daughter in their own home. For a number of years, he has owned an auto repair shop, where he has garnered the valuable experience he needs to do a good job and earn a good income. The business is strategically located in an area known for mechanical service and has many customers. Demand has been strong because Cruz Jaime offers quality work at reasonable prices and with excellent service. He always welcomes customers with a smile.

Cruz works hard and wants to succeed. He has many goals, one of which is to grow his business and stay ahead of the competition. He believes that champions are not fashioned in a gym; rather they have a desire, a dream, a vision deep inside. With this in mind, he decided to apply to INTEGRAL for a loan to buy tools, replacement parts, and more. Cruz Jaime has good credit references and impeccable character. He promises to pay his loan and is sure that he will be able to provide financial security to his household.

loans.use: to buy tools and replacement parts.

loans.name: Tuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuya, age 39, runs a seamstress business in which she purchases silk material and manufactures silk dresses. She has been running this business for four years out of a rental apartment. She lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband works in a thermal power station. 
 
Using the profits from her previous loan from our organization, the couple has built the foundation of their own house on their own land. However, due to insufficient finances, the house’s primary living area is not completed. Thus, as winter comes to Mongolia, there is excessive loss of heating and the couple is experiencing extremely cold conditions in the home. 

To remedy this situation, Mrs. Tuya is requesting a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 MNT in order to install windows, a door, and a roof. As a result of this loan, they will be able to live in a comfortable place. They will also burn a good deal less coal, thereby saving money and significantly reducing air pollution. 

Mrs. Tuya is a very hard-working individual who has a reliable record of loan payment.

loans.use: to install windows, a door, and a roof

loans.name: Bendu

texts.en: Bendu, 30, stopped her education in the 10th grade. She lives together with her friend in the Paynesville South community. She is a hardworking mother with two children, ages 2 and 16. Only one of them attends school. For the past 10 years, she has been selling body cream, body powder, body wash, both men's and women's spray, hair grease, and hand cream. Bendu learned to sell from her friend. She makes a profit when she sells because she has many customers. She uses the profit to buy more goods and support her children. She sells from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and she is grateful to the lender for empowering her in her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more body cream, body wash, hand wash, and women's and men's spray for the business. Her plan is to give her children a higher level of education.

loans.use: to purchase more body cream, body wash, hand wash, and women's and men's spray for the business

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is from Batumi. She is 40 years old, married, and lives with her husband and 20-year-old daughter. Her husband works as a guard and her daughter is a shop consultant. Both of her family members earn a monthly salary. 

She has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for starting a business, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected every time because of her low income and the lack of experience in the new business, which is usually demanded by local credit providers. 

Nino used to have a vet shop, which was stopped because of financial problems. She requested a loan from Credo to start a small business. Her loan request was approved via the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program includes business start-up and re-startup loans with conditions appropriate for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

Nino already has obtained a building for the grocery store in the basement of 5-story building. With the loan, she will purchase inventory, as well as refrigerators for the store and meet her first customers. She will sell a variety of grocery products and is sure that the store will function profitably, as there are no similar stores nearby. The new business initiative, financed with a Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. The family members will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs, in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and a refrigerator for her grocery store

loans.name: Dolera

texts.en: Dolera is a 61-year-old hard-working man living in Masindi, Uganda. He operates an electronics shop and with the profits earned, he has been able to pay school fees for his children and buy land for farming. Like most good fathers, he desires to educate his children up to the university level and set up other sustainable income generating activities to secure their future.Stringent operational policies by local government hinders his business and his business desire is to trade in wholesale. Dolera intends to use the loan to buy electronics such as cables and bulbs to sell.

loans.use: to buy electronics such as cables and bulbs to sell.

loans.name: Irada

texts.en: Irada is 37 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in the Gardabani district, East Georgia. The family is involved in the agricultural business. In particular, they buy different kinds of vegetables and re-sell them in the capital city at the open market. Each member of the family is actively involved in the transportation and trading of the vegetables. Irada is a very hardworking woman and has a rich experience in her business. Irada requested a loan for purchasing the stock of the vegetables. After they buy the new stock of vegetables, they will be able satisfy the needs of their customers. The number of customers and the price of vegetables will be increased in the winter times. This will significantly increase the income of the family and they will be able to improve their living conditions. Irada awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase stock of vegetables

loans.name: Ushirika Group

texts.en:
This is the Ushirika Group, located in the Lugari district of Kenya. It is a group of 11 women and six men and is led by Beatrice, pictured on the right with her hand raised. 

Beatrice is receiving an input loan for a half acre of maize and sorghum cultivation.	Beatrice is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to increase her production.

Last year, Beatrice harvested three bags of maize on a half acre of land. She is excited to improve her harvest as a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. Her biggest concern is sending her children to school. She plans on using future profits from the harvest to support her children’s studies. Additionally, she eventually would like to practice poultry farming. 

For the 2013 Long Rains season, Beatrice’s group members will take input loans of a half acre each. In total, this group will receive input loans for use on 8.5 acres of land.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, age 50, is a farmer in Ndaragwa County in Kenya. She has been practicing mixed farming for the past 30 years. Her farm produces milk and vegetables, which Margaret sells at the local market in her area. She tells us that drought is her primary challenge as a farmer. She runs a retail shop as an additional source of income. Margaret lives with her two children, both of whom are enrolled in school.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 20,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo. She will use her loan funds to purchase farm inputs, which will assist her in expanding her farming and increasing her harvest. She will gain more income as a result, which will help her improve her family's living standards and pay for her children's schooling.
 
Margaret believes the future is promising now that she is working with Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 45 and married with three children that are between the ages of 15 and 29. They stay with their mother in the Paynesville South community and attend school. Annie has been working hard for the past twelve years, managing her business. She sells rice, palm oil, vita, pepper, salt, onions, and tomatoes at the community market. She learned to sell from her mother and received the initial capital from her husband to start in this business. She sells twelve hours a day and makes profit because of her good relationship with customers.
 
Annie transports her goods by commercial vehicle. She thanks lenders for their support that they are giving to improve her business. She is requesting this loan to purchase more pepper, salt, rice, and palm oil for the business, and hopes to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, salt, rice, and palm oil, for the business

loans.name: Londa

texts.en: Londa is 26 years old. She lives with her four children (2, 3, 6, and 7 years old) and her mother-in-law in Abasha district, West Georgia. Her mother-in-law is provided with a retirement pension. Londa is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has four milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. She milks the cows and produces cheese and sells approximately 60 kg locally in an open market at a good price. In addition, she has two pigs and sells piglets locally. She owns 1.2 hectare of agricultural land, where she grows nut trees. The harvested nuts are sold locally at a good price. Londa is a very hard working woman and has a rich experience in her business. Londa requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow. After purchasing an additional milk cow she will be able to produce more dairy products. It will significantly increase the income of the family, and she will be able to improve the living conditions for her children. Londa awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase an additional milk cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed concentrate.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis Antonio tiene 45 años, Es casado vive con la esposa y tres hijos, en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. LUCHANDO POR UNA MISMA CAUSA, se encuentra ubicada en el en el Recinto La primavera, perteneciente al Canton Ventans, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz y arroz.

Luis Antonio se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y frejol. Compra sus productos en Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, urea, insecticidas, liquido mata maleza, insumos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría ha que las siembras se desarrollen de buena manera. 

El sueño es comprarce un carro. Los desafíos a los que se nefrenta es las plagas la langosta. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar indor.
texts.en:
Luis Antonio, 45, is married.  He lives with his wife and three children in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

The members of Luchando por una Misma Causa Communal Bank are located in the La Primavera community in Ventanas Canton. This communal bank consists of short-cycle farmers who grow corn and rice.

Luis Antonio makes a living in agriculture growing corn and beans.  He buys his products in Ventanas.

He's requesting the loan to buy seeds, urea, insecticide, liquid weedkiller, and supplies.  The support of the loan will help the crops to grow well.

His dream is to buy himself a car.  The challenges he faces are locusts.  In his free time he likes to play indoor soccer.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, insecticide, liquid weedkiller, and supplies

loans.name: Gladys America

texts.es:
GLADYS AMERICA tiene 54 años de edad de estado civil unión libre no tiene hijos, vive en casa de unos familiares en la ciudad de Guaranda.

Es integrante de la VRC Cuatro Esquinas Central. esta ubicada a 20 minutos de la oficina conformada por 16 socios que son de la misma comunidad.

GLADYS AMERICA se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar pollos, vacunas, balanceado. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los pollos para criarlos, engordarlos y venderlos. Las compras las realizará en la ciudad de Guaranda. El sueño es tener una granja. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta descanzar y disfrutar de las fiestas de navidad.
texts.en: Gladys América, 54, is in a free union and has no children.  She lives in relatives’ house in Guaranda.  She’s a member of the “Cuatro Esquinas Central” communal bank located 20 minutes from the office; it has 16 members who are from the same community.  Gladys América works raising and selling chickens.  She’s requesting the loan to buy chicks, vaccines and feed.  With help from the loan she will be able to buy chicks to raise, fatten up and sell.  She will make her purchases in Guaranda.  Her dream is to own a farm.  She likes to rest in her free time and to enjoy the Christmas festivities.

loans.use: to buy chicks, feed and vaccines.

loans.name: Eustolio

texts.es: Eustolio tiene cincuenta y dos años de edad y desde pequeño aprendió a trabajar en el campo al lado de su padre y sus hermanos quienes son productores de café. Él está casado con Sofía desde hace mas de treinta años y tiene tres hijos ya casados y dos hijos solteros que aún están estudiando pero que también ayudan a la producción de café pues para ellos esto es un negocio familiar. Eustolio es de los productores que se preocupa de la calidad de su café desde el comienzo del proceso ya que él mismo cuenta con un vivero en el cual produce la planta que siembra además también vende parte de estas plantas a otros productores de la región. Para la siguiente cosecha Eustolio necesita comprar fertilizantes para mantener la producción que en años anteriores ha tenido y para eso necesita de un crédito el cual pagará al final de la cosecha. A Eustolio le gustaría arreglar el techo de su casa ya que tiene muchas goteras y también su cocina pues la que tiene actualmente es de madera.
texts.en: Eustolio, 52, learned how to work in the fields alongside his father and brothers who are coffee growers when he was still a little boy.  He’s married to Sofía for more than 30 years and has three married children and two single children who are still in school but who also help with the coffee growing because this is a family business.  Eustolio is one of the growers who is concerned about the quality of his coffee from the very beginning of the process since he himself has a nursery where he produces the plants that he plants and also sells to other growers in the region.  Eustolio needs to buy fertilizer for the next harvest to maintain the production he’s had in previous years and needs a loan to do so, which he will repay at the end of the harvest season.  Eustolio would like to repair the roof on his house because it leaks and also the kitchen because it’s currently wood.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for a productive harvest.

loans.name: Juntos Al Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
Iván tiene 35 años de edad, es soltero,  reside en una comunidad rural del municipio de Lepaera Departamento de Lempira.
Desde siempre se ha dedicado a las actividades agrícolas específicamente a la producción y venta de granos básicos y al cultivo de café.
En este momento ha solicitado un préstamo grupal el cual piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes para abonar la finca de café y el pago de mano de obra en el corte y cosecha de este cultivo.
Con el apoyo financiero lograra obtener una mejor cosecha, lo cual le motiva a seguir produciendo y ampliando su área de cultivo. Su meta  es superarse económicamente obteniendo mejores ganancias.
Iván pertenece al grupo solidario denominado “Juntos al Desarrollo”, dicho grupo está conformado por 4 personas que en la foto se identifican de la siguiente manera: de izquierda a derecha José, María , Iván (coordinador del grupo) y Lorenzo. Todos los integrantes se dedican a la producción y venta de café en pergamino húmedo, además residen en la misma comunidad y utilizarán el préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y pago de mano de obra en el corte y recolecta del grano.
El préstamo total Grupal es de 45,000 Lempiras.
texts.en:
Iván is 35 years old, single, and resides in a rural community in the town of Lepaera, Department of Lempira.  He has always been involved in farm work, specifically producing and selling basic grains and coffee.  

At the moment, Iván is participating in a group loan request because he plans to invest in the purchase of fertilizers for his coffee farm and to pay for labor to help with pruning and harvesting his crops.  With this financial support, he will be able to achieve a better harvest.  This will motivate him to continue producing and expanding his crop.  Iván’s goal is to excel financially by generating more income.  

Iván is part of the solidarity group named “Juntos al Desarrollo” (Together for Development).  This group consists of four people and the members appear in the photo from left to right as follows:  José, María, Iván (the group coordinator), and Lorenzo.  All of them produce and sell wet parchment coffee.  They all reside in the same community and will use this loan to buy fertilizers and pay for labor needed to prune coffee plants and collect the beans.  

The total group loan is in the amount of 45,000 HNL.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Norma Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Norma tiene 31 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos, reside junto a su familia en una comunidad del Municipio de La Lima, Departamento de Cortes.
Norma se dedica a la venta de alimentos de la canasta básica a través de una pulpería.  En la pulpería vende harina, manteca, condimentos, granos básicos, lácteos, golosinas y refrescos.
Actualmente ha solicitado un crédito por la cantidad de 15000 Lempiras los cuales serán invertidos en la compra de granos básicos, carnes, lácteos y productos enlatados.
Considera que el financiamiento le servirá para  ofrecer más variedad de productos a sus clientes y aumentar sus ventas e ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Norma is 31 years old and married.  She has 3 children and lives with her family in a community in the municipality of La Lima in the department of Cortes.  

Norma has a business selling basic consumer goods from her store.  In her store, she has flour, butter, condiments, grains, dairy products, snacks and beverages.

At this time, she is requesting a loan for 15,000 Honduran lempiras to invest in grains and basic consumer goods including meat, dairy products and canned goods.

She thinks that this loan will help her to offer a greater variety of products to her customers, so that her sales and earnings will increase and her family's quality of life will improve.

loans.use: to buy grains and other basic consumer goods such as meat, dairy products and canned goods

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar, tiene la edad  de 44 años, está casado, vive con sus hijos y esposa  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de sarán y materiales para realizar una tapo al almácigo de café y de esta manera protegerlo lo más que se pueda de los rayos del sol y así sobreviva al verano. Además de poder tener unas plantas de almácigo de buena calidad para la siembra y así aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Oscar is 44 years old, married, and lives with his children and wife who are his highest priority. With his credit he intends to purchase shade providing material ("sarán") and supplies to make a cover for his coffee nursery. This will protect the nursery from the sun's rays so that the seedlings will survive the summer. Besides being able to have good quality seedlings to plant and increase the density of plants in the area, he will be able to take advantage of the soil's fertility, the region's good climatic conditions, and other factors that favor the cultivation of coffee. 

With these improvements to his cultivation, he hopes to obtain a little bit of profit,  which he will use to improve his family's quality of life, invest in his work, and achieve some goals. 

This is the first loan Oscar will receive from Fundecosur. He hasn't had loans with state banks before, but Fundecosur has provided this loan with better facilities and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to improve his coffee nursery

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fruits in wholesale.

loans.name: Monsom Group

texts.en:
Martha and Rukaya make up the Monsom Group. They have been together since 2010 and have been very loyal to ID Ghana. Rukaya deals in assorted soaps.

Martha is a 38-year-old trader. She is a single parent with one child. She has been with ID Ghana for the past two years and is doing very well, both with her business and her family. 

Martha has been selling fruits and vegetables for five years. She sells from Monday to Saturday. She opted for this business because she dropped out of school, due to lack of funds. But, with her introduction to ID Ghana, she is now doing very well in life. 

This is Martha's third loan. She needs 500 GHS to buy more fruit and jewelry to sell to her customers. Combined, the partners need 950 GHS to buy more goods to sell to their customers in the community.

loans.use: to buy fruit and jewelry for resale to her customers.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is a 52-year-old farmer in Ndaragwa county, Kenya, where she lives with her husband. All her children are adults and have finished schooling. Nancy has been in farming for the past 30 years, producing milk, maize and horticultural crops, which she sells at the local market in her area.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo, to buy and insure a dairy cow. She will sell the milk from the cow and earn extra income, which will help her to improve her livelihood and to pay for her late daughter’s children's schooling.

Drought and diseases are her major challenges in farming.

Nancy says she is happy to have found a reliable partner in Juhudi Kilimo, which helps people like her to get loans.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum

loans.name: Marie Madeleine

texts.fr: Madeleine est une femme de 36 mariée mère de famille. Elle commerçante et fait l’élevage des poulets qu'elle revend depuis 8 mois dans un quartier de la capitale. Son élevage fonctionne bien elle conquis et fidélisé une clientèle au fil du temps. elle s’accroît au jour le jour et elle n'arrive plus à la satisfaire d'où l'importance de ce crédit qui lui non seulement d'augmenter son stock de poussin, mais aussi de se procurer la provende pour leur nutrition. cela augmentera ses ventes surtout avec l'approche des fêtes et dons son bénéfice aussi augmentera. Elle réinvestira une partie de ces revenus dans son activité le reste lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins ainsi que sa famille.
texts.en:
Madeleine is 36 years old, married and a mother of a family. She is a trader, and for eight months has been rearing chickens for resale in an area of the capital city. Her farm is working well, and she has won the loyalty of a customer base over the course of time; this customer base is growing on a daily basis and she is no longer able to meet the demand - hence the importance of this loan not only to increase her livestock numbers but also to buy feed for them.
This will increase her sales, especially with the upcoming holiday season, and thus her profits will also rise. She will invest part of the income into the business, and the rest will allow her to meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her stock of chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Om-Hosam Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om-Hasam. It consists of four women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. Together, they have applied for a loan in the amount of 200,000 YER. 

Bahjah, age 45, is a member of Om-Hasam. She has been operating a tailoring business for the past year. She describes her biggest challenge as insufficient funds for improving her business. 

She and her husband have six children.

Bahjah is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB, which she will use to buy more sewing products for her business. 

In the future, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sewing products for her tailoring business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Sara

texts.fr: Sara est une femme de 38 ans mariée, mère de famille. Elle commerçante et vend du pain avec du haricots et autres sauces en matinée depuis 1 ans dans un quartier de la capitale.Son savoir faire dans ce domaine et les prix pratiqués lui ont permis d’acquérir et fidéliser une clientèle qui s'accroît au jour le jour.Ce qui l'amène à vouloir ce crédit parce que son capital ne lui permet plus de satisfaire pleinement sa clientèle.Grâce à lui,elle pourra augmenter son stock en achetant (1 sac de haricot, et un carton de poisson) .Les bénéfices que lui apportera ce crédit seront en partie réinvesti dans son activité et le reste sera économisé pour la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en: Sara is a 38 year old married woman, the mother of a family. She is a trader and sells bread with beans and other sauces - she has been doing this in the mornings for one year, in an area of the capital city. Her knowledge in this field as well as her prices have helped her to get and keep a growing customer base, which is increasing day by day. This has led her to seek this loan, as her capital is no longer sufficient to fully meet demand. With the help of the loan, she will increase her stock by purchasing one bag of beans and one box of fish. The profits generated from this loan will be partly invested in the business, and she will save the rest for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of beans and a box of fish.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
Mamie, age 32, sells dried and fresh fish in and around her local market. She learned this business from friends already engaged in it, and she has found that she is good at this work. She never had the opportunity to attend school, but she says that she had discovered that she is good at managing a business. She lives with her husband, their 12-year-old child, and their two-month-old baby in Buchanan Ground Bassa County.
 
Mamie is requesting a loan in order to purchase fish to offer for sale. She tells us that she likes her business because it helps her to save some money. 

Her plans are to build her house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel, age 28, runs a beauty salon business. She is a young, unmarried Cameroonian living in a semi-urban area. She lives with her parents and she is the breadwinner for the family. Rachel has run her beauty salon shop for the past three years.

This loan will help Rachel to buy a new hair-drying machine, hair products, and hair mesh. 

Her primary goal is to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy a new hair-drying machine, hair products, and hair mesh

loans.name: Jhim

texts.es:
Jhim, de 35 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y decidido con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Es conviviente  con Jenny quien es ama de casa y es madre de sus 3 hijos: Jhim de 16 años, Brayan de 07 años y Génesis de 01 año de edad.  Juntos habitan su propia casa en compañía de   sus hijos a quienes quieren mucho.
La actividad que realiza Jhim es el servicio de alquiler  de movilidad de  transporte de pasajeros dentro de la ciudad, para lo cual cuenta con una unidad de transporte público, que adquirió con el apoyo de su pareja, y lo alquilan  a una persona responsable que le paga por día trabajado. También cuenta con un empleo en una empresa privada, teniendo de esa manera varios ingresos económicos.
Se inició hace más de 16 años, comprando su vehículo con los ahorros mutuos con su pareja renovando su vehiculo con el desgaste por el trabajo, también lo conduce en sus ratos libres.
Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja y la demanda que tiene el público de este servicio.
Decidió empezar con este negocio por el deseo de contar con propios ingresos económicos para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, que son su mayor motivación.
Por tanto, viendo los resultados de su negocio, tiene deseos de continuar y aumentar el número de unidades vehiculares. Con el monto que solicita, podrá comprar repuestos de motos como llantas y otros para dar mantenimiento a su vehículo, buscando precios cómodos por sus compras, así su vehículo estará operativo y obtendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Jhim, 35, is a hardworking and determined man with a great desire to get ahead.  He lives with Jenny, a housewife and the mother of his three children: Jhim, 16, Brayan, 7, and Génesis, 1.  They live together in their own house with their children, whom they love very much.

Jhim's job is renting a vehicle for passenger transportation services in the city.  He has one vehicle for public transportation that he acquired with the support of his partner, and they rent it to a responsible person who pays him per day worked.  He also has a job in a private company.  This way he has several incomes.

He started more than 16 years ago, buying his vehicle with his and his partner's mutual savings and renovating the wear and tear from work.  He also drives it in his spare time.  He thinks his business is very profitable because of the profits he earns and the public demand for his service.

He decided to start this business because he wanted to have his own income to give a better quality of life to his family, who are his main motivation.

Seeing the results of his business, he wants to continue and expand the number of vehicles.  With the requested amount he'll be able to buy tires and other motorcycle parts, and provide maintenance on his vehicle.  He'll look for good prices for his purchases so his vehicle will be operable and he'll have greater profits.

loans.use: to buy tires and parts for motorcycles

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto, 57 años de edad,  originario de Estelí, pero tiene 23 años de vivir en Managua, soltero, padre de 2 hijos mayores de edad, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa en general desde hace 4 años. Inicio su actividad laboral  motivado por su mama, quien siempre ha sido comerciante, ya que el no le ha gustado trabajarle a nadie, fue allí que decidió establecer su propio negocio como es la tienda de ropa y el alquiler de cuartos, el cual lo inicio con capital propio, que permitió el incremento de sus ventas, generando a la vez mas ingreso, pero el desea diversificar sus productos especialmente los que están de moda en esta temporada.  
 Rigoberto requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería en general  como bolsos, zapatos, ropa, sandalias, zapatillas, etc. Con el objetivo de invertir aun más en su inventario para mayor atracción del clientes, en el negocio recibe el apoyo de sus nietos, el estima que este crédito será  de gran ayuda porque podrá mantener su negocio activo  con productos mas solicitado por los clientes, sus planes futuros es ampliar su tienda  y mejorar las condiciones de los cuartos de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rigoberto, is 57 yeras old and originally from Estelí, but has lived in Managua for 23 years. He is not married, and has 2 grown up children.

As a businessman, he works selling clothing, and has done so for 4 years. He started this work motivated by his mother, who has always been a seller. Since he did not like working for anybody, he decided to set up his own business - the clothing shop and also renting rooms, which he started with his own money. This allowed him to increase his sales, generating at the same time a larger income, but he wants to diversify his products, especially those which are in fashion in the winter season.

Rigoberto needs the loan to buy general merchandise such as bags, shoes, clothes, sandals, heels etc. with the objective of investing even more into his inventory. This will attract more clients. He receives support from his grandchildren who help with the business. He believes that this loan will be of great help because he will be able to maintain his active business with more products that customers are asking for. His future plan is to expand his shop and improve the condition of his children's rooms.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as bags, shoes, clothes, sandals, heeled shoes etc.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es:
Teodora de 62 años, casada con Luis de 63 años tiene hasta hoy la tranquilidad de saber que sus 2 hijos Cesario y Carmen  ya mayores son personas de amplia dedicación laboral gracias a la educación y buenos valores que les impartió desde niños. Es poseedora de una vivienda a base de material noble. Algo ya cansada de las actividades agropecuarias a las que se dedico toda su vida decidió darse un pequeño límite de trabajo iniciándose como vendedora de platos típicos como el caldo de mote pelado conocido como “Mondongo” en un cómodo ambiente de su vivienda especialmente los fines de semana.
Lleva 5 años degustando a vecinos y conocidos de su barrio quienes acuden constantemente a su local logrando así hacer de su pequeño negocio un buen sustento económico. 
A manera de realizar un pequeño ajuste de su negocio desea contar con capital para realizar la reparación de una congeladora que usa para helar distintas bebidas como gaseosas y cremoladas así como capital para solventar los gastos que genera la preparación de dicho plato logrando así desempeñarse con mayor fluidez.
Se siente aun con muchas fuerzas para trabajar, pues gracias al dinero que fue reuniendo desde hace mucho logró adquirir una parcela adicional de cultivo con el  cual espera asegurar su vejes así como el de su esposo con el alquiler de la misma. Con los 2,000 nuevos soles espera realizar la reparación de una congeladora que usa para su negocio así como poseer capital de respaldo en la preparación de su pequeño restaurante.
texts.en:
Teodora is 62 and married to Luis, 63. They are content that their adult children Cesario y Carmen are hardworking people, thanks to the education and values they provided to them. They own a well-built house. After spending most of her life farming, Teodora decided to limit her workday and started selling regional dishes on weekends such as “Mondongo,” a peeled mote soup, in a comfortable space in her home.

For five years, she served neighbors, who came so frequently that her small business became a good income source. She wants to secure working capital to do small renovations such as repairing the refrigerator she uses for beverages like sodas and frozen drinks. The capital will help her pay food preparation costs and run the business smoothly.

She still likes to work hard, and she has used money she earned over the years to buy more crop land that she hopes to rent, along with that of her husband, to pay for their later years. With the 2,000 nuevos soles, she wants to repair the refrigerator she uses for her business and have working capital for her small restaurant.

loans.use: to repair the refrigerator, buy supplies, and invest in her restaurant.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
El Sr. David es indudablemente una persona valiente y trabajador, David se define como una persona humilde, honrada, que ama a su esposa y a sus dos hijos, no le importa trabajar, lo importante para él es sacar adelante a su familia.

El crédito solicitado a Fodemi se lo invertirá en la compra de cerdos reproductores y de balanceado para su alimentación,  para criarlos y luego venderlos, ya que tienen mucha demanda en estos tiempos y es una oportunidad que no deben dejar pasar, ya que sus cerdos son sanos y reconocidos.

El sueño que David tiene es comprarse un terreno grande donde construirá un galpón grande y poder seguir con su trabajo en la crianza y venta de credos, y pueda triplicar la producción que tiene en estos momentos, esta consiente que cumplir su sueño es posible pero tiene que trabajar, y es por ello que todos los días se levanta agradeciendo a dios por un día más de vida, donde pueda trabajar para poder cumplir su sueño
texts.en:
Señor David is undoubtedly a brave and hard-working person. He describes himself as a humble and honest man who loves his wife and two children. He feels that taking care of his family is more important to him than working.

The loan David has asked Fodemi for will be invested in buying breeding pigs and feed for them so that he can raise and then sell them, since there is a lot of demand now and he cannot pass up the opportunity, since his pigs are healthy and well-known.

David's dream is to buy a large plot of land where he can build a large barn and carry on working raising and selling pigs, and triple the production he has now. He knows that it is possible to realise his dream but that he has to work, and this is why he gets up every day thankful to God for one more day so that he can work to be able to realise his dream.

loans.use: to buy breeding pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her capital and purchase many items for her shop (rice, potatoes, palm oil, etc.) to resell in order to earn more.

loans.name: Al-Nada Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Nada. It consists of three ladies who live in Aden, Yemen. Fawziah is 48 years of age. She is a married woman and has six children. Her business is a retail one; she sells perfumes, incense, and clothes. She applied for a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB to buy more perfumes, incense, and clothes for her business. The profits generated will allow her to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy more perfumes, incense, and clothes for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase flour and beans.

loans.name: Andreja

texts.en:
Andreja is married and has two children ages one and three years old. He works in construction and his wife is a housewife, taking care of their children. They all live in a minority community in a very old small house. They always wanted to build a new house because there is not enough space for them. They also are thinking about their children's future: when they need to go to school the family wants to provide a place for them to study and for a room for them.

Andreja is requesting a loan to build one anex in his house in order to expand the living area of his house. The loan will help them to improve their living conditions. He hopes in the future to be able to offer a better life to his family. His goal is to give their children a better education. He wants to thank all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To build one anex in his house

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia de cuarenta y siete años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida Ramón y su hija en casa propia.
