loans.use: to buy more textiles to make sports attire

loans.name: Josephine's Group

texts.en:
Josephine's group is comprised of 4 hardworking women. Josephine, 18 years old, lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Josephine has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Josephine has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase her stock of essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar,and salt to attract more customers, and will help Josephine to generate greater profits and to pay for her medical bills. Josephine hopes that, in the future, she will be able to start a big supermarket in town. 

Josephine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to increase her stock of essential commodities to attract more customers

loans.name: Natsadorj

texts.en:
Mr. Natsagdorj, 46, lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own apartment. Their daughter has been studying at university for two years in Korea. The family's main income comes from a food store and internet café; both businesses were started in 2010. Operational apartments are rented for long term and therefore business is stabilized over the years. 

In order to expand his business, he is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 Tugriks (MNT) to increase the current assets of his business. As a result, he can generate more income for his family also can contribute to national economic prosperity because small and medium sized businesses are vital to economic development. In addition, the borrower has a goal of building his own block factory in the future.

loans.use: to increase current assets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 22 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 3 years, Juliet has been working hard to manage her market stall, which sells raw food.

To help expand her business, Juliet has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more raw food such as cassava and sweet potatoes, and will help Juliet to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. Juliet hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own.

Juliet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more raw food such as cassava and sweet potatoes for resale

loans.name: Jalil

texts.en:
Jalil is 53 years old and is married with one child. Jalil has worked as a driver for 10 years. Now he helps move people from one region to another.

To support better family living conditions, he was engaged with fruits and vegetables selling. His wife was helping him but after she has got sick he had to stop this business as he had no financial support and help. 

Today after six months he decided to continue the trading business and applied for the loan 1000 Azerbaijanian Manats (AZN) to buy fruits and vegetables to start selling at the local market that he has rented.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables to start selling at the local market that he has rented.

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Prisca has been working hard to manage her market stall, which sells raw food.

To help expand her business, Prisca has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more raw bananas called matooke to be sold, and will help Prisca to generate greater profits and pay her medical bills. Prisca hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own.

Prisca is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more raw bananas called matooke to be sold

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl is married with two children. Liezl is 29 years old and lives in Banigan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Liezl sells noodles, canned goods and other items to earn a living, and has had this business for one year. Each month, she earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP for additional capital to purchase more items to sell.

Liezl has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Liezl hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, canned goods and other items.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is single and has two children; one of them is currently in school. For the past two years, Christine has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase stock of essential commodities, such as milk, cooking oil, sugar and salt, that will attract more customers, hence increasing profits. This will help Christine to generate greater profits and pay her medical bills. Christine hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business into a big supermarket. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to increase stock of essential commodities, such as milk, cooking oil, sugar and salt, that will attract more customers, hence increasing profits.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 24 years old and lives in the suburbs of Tbilisi city with her mother and brother. Several times, Diana has requested loans from local financial institutions for her trading business start-up, but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is the small monthly income earned by Diana working as a saleslady. 

Diana requested a loan from Credo to start a clothing sales business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with reasonable conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Diana will purchase clothes in Turkey at wholesale prices and resell them in the local market for a profit. It will be hard work for Diana, but according to estimations, her business will be profitable and will increase the income of the family. The increased profit will be reinvested in her clothing trading business to increase her stock and sales volume. The family members will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Violet's Group

texts.en:
Violet's group is comprised of five hard-working women. Violet is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is single and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Violet has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Violet has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar, and salt that will attract more customers. This will help Violet generate greater profits and pay her medical bills. Violet hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a big supermarket. 

Violet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar, and salt that will attract more customers.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: Nelson de 31 años de edad tiene su negocio en el centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla, zona comercial que alberga gran cantidad de negocios de diversos tamaños y líneas de productos, siendo el de él la venta de accesorios femeninos y cosméticos, con el que planea su futuro.   Cuando Nelson inició su negocio, ya había abonado el terreno para lograrlo; primero empezó a trabajar como jefe de meseros y se dispuso ahorrar para ser independiente, desarrollar su espíritu libre, emprendedor y  su propia autonomía. Aun en ese tiempo no sabía a qué se dedicaría, pero las relaciones comerciales que observaba, fueron direccionando sus posibilidades, especialmente  conociendo a los  comerciantes de artículos de bisutería. Así fue  que compro una colmena o punto comercial donde iniciar y como siguió trabajando como empleado, pudo obtener otra unidad de negocios y continuar en el restaurante,  donde aún es apoyado por sus jefes,  para que progrese teniendo sus negocios también y generando empleos, porque para ellos  cuenta con una auxiliar de ventas. Él se siente muy feliz con sus actividades, pues gracias a ellas, ha logrado viajar a otros países como Panamá y Perú; Nelson se considera muy emprendedor y con un potencial exitoso para salir adelante.  En su negocio abre sus puertas de Lunes a Domingos desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6:30 de la tarde, vende de contado y tiene como propósito hacer crecer su negocio, por eso se acerca a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para aplicar a un crédito, primer financiamiento que hace mediante el fondo  Kiva, con el cual comprará a un mayor volumen, productos de bisutería,  como collares, ganchos, aretes y pulseras;  con ellos  renovará sus inventarios y obtendrá por compras de contado y en mayor cantidad,  precios que trasladará a su clientela,  para que se sientan felices con su respuesta oportuna y regresen a comprarle.
texts.en:
Nelson is 31 years old. His business is in the center of the city of Barranquilla in the commercial zone, which is home to a large number of businesses of different sizes and product lines. He sells female accessories and cosmetics, with which he plans his future.

When Nelson started his business, he had already paved the way to success. He first started working as the head waiter and began saving to be independent, and develop his free, entrepreneurial spirit. Even at that time he didn't know to what he would devote himself, but with the trade relations he observed, he was directed to the costume jewelry merchants. So he bought a commercial point to start while he continued working so he could start his business while continuing at the restaurant. Therefore, he would be supported while creating his business and creating his own jobs, such as sales assistant.

He is very happy with his activities, because thanks to them, he has managed to travel to other countries, such as Panama and Peru. Nelson is considered very enterprising and successful with the potential to grow. 

In his business, the doors are open Monday to Sunday from 8:00 in the morning until 6:30 in the afternoon. He wants to grow his business, so he approached the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to apply for a loan financed by Kiva. 

With this loan, he will buy a large volume of jewelry such as necklaces, clips, earrings, and bracelets. With them he will renew his inventory and get more since he is purchasing with cash and in a large quantity. The prices will transfer to his customers, so they will feel happy and return to buy more from him.

loans.use: to buy a large volume of jewelry, such as necklaces, clips, earrings and bracelets.

loans.name: Fernanda Leonor

texts.es:
FERNANDA LEONOR tiene 20 años de edad de estado civil uniòn libre tiene dos hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos en la ciudad de Ventanas Provincia de los rìos.

Es integrante de la VRC LA VICTORIA, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Pantano, pertenece al Cantón Ventanas se dedican a labores Agrícolas y Pecuarias.

FERNANDA LEONOR  se dedica a la siembra de maíz, arroz. Las compras las realizarà en la ciudad de Ventanas. Solicita el crèdito para comprar semillas, urea, fertilizantes, insecticidas, ranger.

 Con la ayuda del crédito ayudarà a la familia a mejorar la calidad de vida. El sueño es comprarce una casa.Los desafìos a los que se enfrentan son las plagas y enfermedades en las plantaciones. 

En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte en especial el bono.
texts.en:
Fernanda Leonor, 20, lives with her husband and two children in the city of Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.  She is a member of the communal bank LA VICTORIA in the Pantano Community which belongs to the Ventanas Canton.  Here, most people work in agriculture and livestock farming.

Fernanda Leonor grows corn and rice, and buy supplies in the city of Ventanas.  She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, urea, ferilizers and insecticides.

The loan will help improve her family's quality of life.  Her goal is to buy a house.  The challenges she is up against are plant plagues and diseases.

In her free time, she enjoys sports.

loans.use: To buy seeds, urea, fertilizers, and insecticides.

loans.name: Milton Jacinto

texts.es:
MILTON JACINTO tiene 32 años de edad, de estado civil unión libre tiene 5 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.

Pertenece a la  VRC EL RECREO, se encuentra ubicada en el sector del recinto San Vicente las lomas, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores pecuarias y agrícolas.

 MILTON JACINTO se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz y a la crianza de cerdos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semillas, abonos, insecticidas y balanceado para engorde de cerdos. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá mejorar los cultivos y engordar a los cerdos para venderlo en un buen precio.

Las compras y las ventas lo hace en Ventanas cada mes. El sueño es poder tener buena cosecha y verder bien los animales para tener dinero para hacer una casa. Los desafíos a los que se enfrentan son las plagas y los precios de los animales de la competencia.

En el tiempo libre le gusta hacer deporte con los hijos.
texts.en:
Milton Jacinto, 32, lives with his common-law wife and five children in Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.  He belongs to the communal bank EL RECREO, located in the San Vicente Las Lomas Community which belongs to the Ventanas Canton.  Here, people work in agriculture and livestock farming.

Milton Jacinto farms corn and rice, and raises pigs.  He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and balanced animal feed for the pigs.  The loan will allow him to improve the crops and fatten the pigs so he can sell them at a good price.

He buys supplies in Ventanas every month.  His goal is to have a good harvest and sell his animals well so he can build a house.  The challenges he is up against are plant disease and competitive livestock prices.

In his free time, he enjoys playing sports with his children.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and balanced animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is single and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Margret has been working hard to manage her market stall, which sells raw foods. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more raw bananas, called matooke, to resell. This will help Margret generate greater profits and pay her medical bills. Margret hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own. 

Margret is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more raw bananas, called matooke, to be resell

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace's group is comprised of five hard-working women. Grace is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past two years, Grace has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt, and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar, and salt to attract more customers.  This will help Grace generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to buy cows and build a house. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar, and salt to attract more customers

loans.name: Nyamaa

texts.en:
Mr. Nyamaa, 23 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in a ger (a traditional Mongolian yurt) in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. His wife, Bayanjargal, age 22, is temporarily unemployed after giving birth to their daughter and she stays home to take care of her.

Nyamaa has been an assistant worker in a small private shoe manufacturing business for years. Since they have a newborn and his wife is not working, Nyamaa is planning to start his own business manufacturing shoes at home with his wife. He is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase starting inventory for his new cobbler business. Nyamaa is a well-behaved, hardworking and responsible man.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for his start-up cobbler business

loans.name: Felipe Francisco

texts.es:
Felipe Francisco tiene 47 años de edad vive en Unión Libre tiene dos hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos en ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC EL RECREO, se encuentra ubicada en el sector del recinto San Vicente las lomas, Perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores pecuarias y agrícolas.

Felipe Francisco se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, fréjol y la crianza de pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar semilla, urea, insecticidas, líquido para la maleza y para balanceado de engorde y morocho para los pollos.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo necesario. Las compras lo harán en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

El sueño es poder comprar lo necesario para los cultivos y un terreno para seguir sembrando. En el tiempo libre le gusta jugar hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Felipe Francisco, 47, lives with his common-law wife and children in Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.  He is a member of the communal bank EL RECREO, in a sector of the San Vicente Las Lomas Community which belongs to Ventanas Canton.  Here, people work in agriculture and livestock farming.

Felipe Francisco farms corn and beans and raises chickens.  He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, urea, insecticides, liquid weedkiller and balanced animal feed for the chickens.

The loan will help him buy everthing he needs; and he will purchase the supplies in Ventanas in Los Ríos Province.

His goal is to buy all he needs for his crops and a patch of land to continue farming.  In his free time, he enjoys sports.

loans.use: To buy seed, urea, insecticides, liquid weed killer and balanced animal feed for the chickens.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
La Sra. Mery es una persona con altos valores espirituales los cuales le han guiado a ser una buena persona, ella se define como una persona perseverante, humilde y muy trabajadora, ella es casada, ama a su esposo y a sus 3 hijos. Mery cree que el trabajo dignifica a la persona y es el único medio de salir adelante.

El crédito solicitado a Fodemi se lo va a invertir en la compra de tela e hilos para la confección de cobijas de bebe, ya que en estas fechas tiene mucha demanda de su producto, ya que es muy conocido en toda la ciudad por su calidad y su precio.

El sueño que Mery tiene es tener más capital para crecer en su microempresa, abarcar un mayor mercado y ser reconocida en toda la ciudad, igualmente sueña con ver a sus hijos crecer y darles una buena educación y sobre todo ser una familia unida por el amor.
texts.en:
Mery is someone with high spiritual values that have made her a good person.  She defines herself as persevering, humble and hard-working.  She is married and loves her husband and three children.  Mery believes work dignifies a person and is the only way to get ahead.

The loan she is requesting through Fodemi is to buy fabric and thread to make baby blankets, since there is a high demand for them at this time of the year.  Her products are well known in the city for their quality and price.

Mery's goal is to have more capital to grow her small business so she can supply to a larger market and be recognized throughout the entire city.  She also wants to see her children grow up with a good education and in a loving family environment.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread to make baby blankets.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
La Sra. Gabriela indudablemente es una persona de admiración, siempre con una sonrisa y alegría que le caracteriza, ella se define como una persona, paciente humilde y muy trabajadora. Ella confía mucho en su trabajo y sus ganas de salir adelante, Gabriela ama a toda su familia y lucha por verles siempre felices.


El crédito solicitado a Fodemi se lo va a invertir en la compra cosméticos de perfumería, cremas corporales y faciales, Para Gabriela es una forma de salir adelante y ayudar a su familia, es una oportunidad de crecimiento personal y familiar, es por ello que Gabriela está muy gustosa de trabajar y con ganas de mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.

El sueño que Gabriela tiene es poder tener un local propio y amplio donde pueda vender todos su productos y diversificar su mercancía y con estos ingresos mejorar su casa y darles la educación a sus hijos, Gabriela tiene mucha fe en Dios, y está convencida que con trabajo y amor su sueño se cumplirá.
texts.en:
Gabriela is undoubtedly an admirable person.  She always has a smile and she is characterized by her happiness.  She is described as a patient, humble, and hard-working person.  She puts a lot of trust in her work and her desire to get ahead.  She loves her entire family and fights to see them always happy.

The loan she is requesting is from FODEMI; she will invest in buying cosmetics, like perfumes, body creams, and facial creams.  For Gabriela, this is a way to continue moving forward and to help her family; it is an opportunity for personal and familial growth.  It is for this that Gabriela is very joyful in her work and desire to better the quality of life for her whole family.

Gabriela's dream is to be able to have her own sufficient space where she can sell all of her products and diversify her merchandise.  With this revenue, she can improve her home and give her children an education.  

Gabriela has a lot of faith in God and is convinced that with hard work and love, her dream will come true.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, like perfume, body creams and facial creams.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: Mauricio, tiene la edad 32 de  años, está casado y vive con la esposa y tres hijos. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de dos vacas de leche para poder darle el mayor provechó posible con los diversos productos. El lo que  pretende es poder vender productos como leche y queso y hasta un poco de natilla. El quiere poder aumentar los ingresos con este nuevo proyecto y así poder aumentar las  ganancias para su bienestar  y la de su familia y crecer con el proyecto de ganado de leche. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Mauricio, who is 32 years old, is married and lives with his wife and three children. 

With the loan he hopes to buy two dairy cows, so that he can gain the best profit possible with the different products. He hopes to be able to sell products like milk and cheese, and even some sour cream. He wants to be able to increase his income with this new project, and so be able to increase his profits, for his own wellbeing and that of his family, and to develop his dairy cattle project.

This is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He had not had other loans before from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided him a loan with more simplicity and with a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle.

loans.name: Soro

texts.ru: Соро 42 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Ее муж работает слесарем в насосной станции. Соро более 1,5 года она тоже  работает в насосной станции. Соро имеет дополнительный доход от выращивания сельхоз культуры. Она каждый год делает посев овощей в арендованном земельном участке. Полученный урожай она продает на местном рынке. Доход от продажи урожая она использует для содержания семьи. Она планирует расширить бизнес и получать больше дохода для улучшения условия проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для покупки семена и минерального удобрения. Она обещает погасить займ во время. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Soro is 42 years old, married, and has five children.  Her husband works as a pipe fitter in a pumping station.  Soro has also worked in the pumping station for over a year and a half.  Soro has an additional income from growing crops.  Every year she plants vegetables on a rented piece of land.  She sells the harvest at the local market.  She uses the income from the sale of the harvest to support her family.  She is planning to expand her business and to earn a larger income to improve their living conditions.  

She is requesting a loan of 2,000 somoni to buy seed and mineral fertilizers.  She promises to repay the loan on time.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy seed and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Annet's Group

texts.en:
Annet's group is comprised of three hardworking women. Annet is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past three years, Annet has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase her stock of different fashionable clothes for reselling, and will help Annet to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child and some of her young relatives who still go to school. Annet hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a house. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to add more fashionable clothes to resell.

loans.name: Agnes' Group

texts.en:
Agnes' group is comprised of 5 hardworking women. Agnes, 23 years old, lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, 2 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her small clothing sales shop. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase her inventory of different fashionable clothes for resale, and will help Agnes to generate greater profits and to pay for her family's medical expenses and school fees. Agnes hopes that, in the future, she will be able to build a permanent house for her children. 

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of fashionable clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase materials for constructing a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Damdin

texts.en:
Damdin is 53 years old and lives with his wife in Ger, in Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife, Gandolgor, is retired and stays home, helping with Damdin's business of preserved, organic vegetable production and sales. Damdin's five children are all married and live separately. 

Damdin has been operating his preserved, organic vegetable production and sales business since 2011. He rents his workplace, working together with his wife and older son, Gerelt-Od. 

Damdin is now requesting 1000000 MNT to purchase a bulk amount of organic vegetables in order to produce more preserved vegetables to sell to local customers. He is a hard-working, enthusiastic, and honest person.

loans.use: to purchase a bulk amount of organic vegetables in order to produce more preserved vegetables to sell to local customers.

loans.name: Tsogjavkhlan

texts.en:
Tsogjavkhlan, 44 years old, is a widow who lives with her son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house. Tsogjavkhlan has been working as a manager at a private company and her son gets a single parent pension. Also using her free time, Tsogjavkhlan provides taxi service to local people. 

This year’s winter is especially harsh and cold, making people chilly to their core. Tsogjavkhlan and her son are in urgent need of an insulated house. So she is requesting a loan of 1,800,000 MNT to buy a storm door, vacuum windows, and other insulation materials. By doing this, the family can live in comfort and most importantly the insulated house will reduce their consumption of coal significantly, thus contributing to efforts to reduce air pollution.

loans.use: to buy a storm door, vacuum windows, and insulation materials

loans.name: Twunganirane Mashesha/rsz Group

texts.fr:
Monsieur Boniface fait l’agriculture d’ananas. Il est marié et  âgé de 50 ans. Il  a 5 enfants dont le plus grand a 18 ans et le moins âgé a 7 ans. Tous ses enfants vont à l’école et aucune autre personne n’est en sa charge.
Il est né au Rwanda et son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de l’école primaire.
Il a commencé de collaborer avec ACB Ltd en 2012 et le cycle actuel lui est premier.
Ce crédit va lui permettre d’acheter les engrais chimiques, fumiers et payer la main d’œuvre.
Il n’attend aucune difficulté de non remboursement de ce prêt.
Il va demander d’autres prêts dans le futur, ceci lui permettra d’accroitre son activité agricole.
Pour son agriculture, il a l’ambition de faire une petite industrie qui fait le jus d’ananas.
Pour sa famille, il va faire son mieux pour assurer le bien être de sa famille et paiera les frais scolaires et académiques de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Boniface is a pineapple farmer. He is 50 years old and married. He has five children, ranging from 18 to 7 years old. All of his children go to school, and he has no other people under his care. He was born in Rwanda and he attended six years of primary school. 

He started to collaborate with ACB Ltd. in 2012, and this is his first loan. This loan is going to allow him to buy fertilizer and manure and to pay for labor. He does not expect any difficulty in repaying this loan. He is going to ask for other loans in the future, and this will allow him to expand his farming. 

For his farming, he hopes to start a small side-business where he makes pineapple juice. For his family, he is going to ensure their well-being and pay for his children's school and academic fees.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure and to pay for labor

loans.name: Lucila Del Rosario

texts.es:
Lucila del Rosario tiene 53 años vive en Venatanas vive en Union Libre tiene 5 hijos vive en casa arrendada en el sector de San Vicente.

Pertenece a la Venatnilla El recreo es nueva socia esta ventanilla se encuentra unbicada en el sector San Vicente Las Lomas, pertenece al Canton Ventanas se dedican a labores Pecuarias y Agricolas.

Lucila se dedica a la agricultura la siembra de Maiz gandul y a la crianza de pollos y patos. Solicita el credito para la compra de insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, liquidos para la maleza y alimento para engorde y crianza de animales.

Con el credito ha podido comprar lo que es necesario para los cultivos y para los animales. El sueño es tener dinero para dar la educacion a los hijos y aumnetar la produccion. 

En los tiempos libres le gusta leer y conversar con la familia.
texts.en: Lucila del Rosario is 53 years old and lives in Ventanas. She has a domestic partner and 5 children. Lucila lives in a rented house in the San Vicente district. She is a new member of the Ventanilla, El Recreo, located in the San Vicente Las Lomas district, Ventanas Canton, which is devoted to livestock and agricultural activities. Lucila works with agriculture, sowing corn and pigeon peas, as well as raising chickens and ducks. She requests the loan in order to buy goods such as fertilizers, composts, liquid products for the weeds and food to fatten and breed animals. With the loan she has been able to buy what is needed for the crop and animals. Her dream is to have money to afford her children’s education and increase production. In her free time she likes reading and talking to her family.

loans.use: To buy goods such as fertilizers, composts, liquid products for the weeds and food to fatten and breed animals.

loans.name: Luzmilda

texts.es: Luzmilda  tiene  44  años de edad, esta casada y vive con el esposo y tres hijos actualmente. Ella con crédito pretende comprar abarrotes como arroz, frijoles, aceite y muchos más. Ella piensa poner su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes ya que en la comunidad que ella vive es de difícil acceso y esta ayudara mucho a ella como a la comunidad. Ella no cuenta con el capital necesario para dicha inversión, por lo que el solicito un crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en:
Luzmilda is 44 years old, married, and currently lives with her husband and three children. With this loan she will buy groceries, like rice, beans, oil and many more. She thinks to put her own grocery store business in the community. Their community is difficult to access and this will help her as well as the community.

She does not have the necessary capital for such an investment, which is why she is asking for a loan. This is the first loan she receives from Fudecosur. She has never gotten a loan from a state bank, but Fudecosur has been very helpful and given much lower interest rates.

loans.use: to buy groceries for sale.

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es: Rolando, un hombre emprendedor y muy humilde, tiene 43 años de edad, es soltero y vive con su familia actualmente, el solicito un préstamo con el anhelo de  comprar insumos como abonos, y fumigantes, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, con la finalidad de mantenerlas en buenas condiciones durante su desarrollo, para obtener un producto de buena calidad y factible a la hora de ser comercializado. Este  agricultor que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio a logrado encaminar su proyecto hasta el día de hoy y la única delimitación que este caballero tiene es la falta de dinero  para continuar creciendo y dando alegría a toda su familia ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, por lo que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito, y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Rolando, at 43, is hardworking, modest, single, and lives with his family. He is applying for a loan to buy supplies such as manure and fumigants for his coffee plantings. This will keep the crop in good condition as it grows, yielding a better quality, more commercial product at the market. This grower has worked hard and sacrificed to make his project the success it is today. His only barrier is the lack of capital to keep growing and making his family happy. His business needs to grow, so he applied and received his first loan from FUDECOSUR. Though he has no prior loans with state banks, FUDECOSUR has offered him a loan with excellent terms and a low interest rate.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Wainer

texts.es: Wainer, un joven emprendedor, tiene 23 años de edad, está  casado y vive con la esposa  actualmente, el utilizara el crédito para la   comprar de insumos como abonos, y herbicidas, el desea dar asistencia a los cultivos de café, para obtener un producto de buena calidad, ya que de esta actividad económica dependen para poder salir adelante, y él desea poder generar más ganancias para obtener una mejor calidad d vida, por lo  que él hace una solicitud  de  crédito , y es el primer  préstamo que ha  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no registra otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja……
texts.en: Weiner, an enterprising 23-year-old is married and living with his wife.  He will use his loan to buy supplies such as fertiliser and weedkiller.  He wants to helps coffee growers to produce a higher quality product as they depend on this work to be able to prosper.  Wainer wants to earn more so that he can have a better quality of life and this is why he needs this loan.  The is Wainer's first loan from FUDECOSUR.  He has no other loans from state banks but FUDECOSUR has given him the simplest loan and the interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Gulnar

texts.ru:
Гулнар родилась в 1963г., в п.Токтогул, Токтогульского района, в семье крестьян. В 1980г. окончила школу им.Боконбаева. После окончания школы 1980 по 1982 гг. отучилась в г.Талас, в медицинском училище. С 1982г  до сегодняшнего работает мед/сестрой, в поликлинике Токтогульского района, дополнительно занимается животноводством. Животноводством начала заниматься с 1983 года, от крестного отца было выделен 1 теленок. На сегодня в хозяйстве имеет: 1 лошадь, 2 коров, 1 теленка, 21 МРС. 
Вышла замуж 1982г., от брака имеет двоих сыновей и двоих дочерей.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулнар обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов коров и мелкого скота. 
В будущем хочет развести скот, построить большой сарай, обеспечить будущее своим детям.
texts.en:
Gulnar was born in 1963 in the Toktogul village, Toktogul region, into a peasant family.  In 1980 she finished Bokonbaev High School, after which she studied at the medical academy in the city of Talas until 1982.  From 1982 to today, she works as a nurse in the Toktugul region polyclinic.  For additional income she has a business in animal husbandry, which she started in 1983 with a calf that she received from her godfather.  Today she has 1 horse, 2 cows, 1 calf, and 21 head of small, horned cattle.  Gulnar married in 1982 and has two sons and two daughters from the marriage.  

With the goal of further developing her business, Gulnar applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for al loan of 135,000 som (KGS) to buy additional cows and small cattle.  In the future, she wants to breed cattle, build a large barn, and provide for her children's future.

loans.use: to purchase cows and sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, thread, and fabric

loans.name: Amunga

texts.en:
Amunga is a 33-year-old salonist and barber shop owner in Bakarani, Mombasa. He is married and supports five people in his family. Amunga has been in this business for the last year and he is doing great.

Amunga will use the requested loan to purchase methylated spirit, cosmetics and hair weaves for the salon and barber shop. He will use the anticipated profit to open up a wine shop. This is Amunga's second loan; the previous loan was repaid successfully. He hopes to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to purchase methylated spirit, cosmetics and hair weaves

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en: Kibibi is taking out a new loan to expand her existing business. With this new investment, she wants to buy more clothes to sell. She wants to take advantage of the December holiday celebrations, a time when sales are high. She is sure that this investment will increase her income. Kibibi is grateful for the support her last loan provided. It helped her to grow her business. She plans to expand her business and open more businesses in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to resell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 43-year-old married woman with four children living in Masindi, Uganda. For eight years she has been selling clothes and she started the business in order to pay school fees for her children. Ever changing customer preferences coupled with inadequate capital hinder her business growth. Her dream is to own a modern boutique in town. Grace intends to use this loan to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more copra (dried coconut meat) to resell

loans.name: Enhtaivan

texts.en:
Enhtaivan is a 50-year-old widow who lives with her daughter in a small house in the Hentii province of Mongolia. Her daughter Uugan-Orgil, age 27, is temporarily unemployed and helps her mother. Enhtaivan has been running a meat sales business in a local market since 1997. Her business stopped in 2011 because her husband got sick and soon after that her husband passed away. 

Enhtaivan is now planning to restart her meat selling business in the local market where she used to run her business before. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase livestock and meat products to resell at retail prices in order to restart her business. Enhtaivan is a diligent, well-behaved, and hardworking woman.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and meat products to resell at retail prices in order to restart her business

loans.name: Gantsooj

texts.en:
Mr. Gantsooj, 28 years old, lives with his wife and children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. The family resides on his father’s plot of land. He has been working as a driver for a company president since 2010. His wife has been working as a weaver since 2001 in a private company. His parents take care of their children when they go to their respective work. 

Beginning in 2011, Mr. Gantsooj has been building his own house, yet unfinished, only completing the house’s exterior sides. As winter comes to Mongolia, he is in urgent need of a complete and insulated house. So Mr. Gantsooj is requesting the loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy construction materials for interior repair and insulating materials. As a result, the family can live in a comfortable place and an insulated house will reduce consumption of coal drastically, thus contributing to environmental protection.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil is 41 years old. He was married and has two beautiful children. Ramil loves his family and spending time with them. Ramil is an IDP (internally displaced person) from Fizuli city, but now lives and works in Baku region with his family.

Ramil needs 2,000 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) to make repairs in his cafe. Ramil opened his own cafe (chay xana) 1 year ago and he wants to improve his new business.

loans.use: to make repairs in his cafe

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a focused business lady, age 24, with one child living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She has a produce shop which she got out of rental collections from buildings given to her by her father. She has a personal goal of educating her sisters and brothers up to the university since the sole responsibility now lays with her after the death of her parents. She has challenges of small capital base, high transport costs and price fluctuations of the produce which limit her profits.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
This is Marilou, she previously accessed an 11,000 PHP loan that she used to buy additional stock of toy products. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock of toy products and candies. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marilou hopes to give her family a good future and dreams of giving her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of toy products and candies needed in her business.

loans.name: Biljana

texts.en:
Biljana, 33 years old, comes from a vulnerable ethnic minority community. She is married and has three children, ranging from 10 to 13 years old, all of whom are in school. Biljana’s husband is employed as a driver in a hospital. Biljana works in kindergarten with very low salary. The money that she and her husband generate is not enough to cover all of the daily living expenses. Many people from these minority communities in Kosovo, such as Biljana and her family, live in poor conditions. They lack access to proper nutrition and care, as well as being exposed to unsanitary conditions.

Although raising children and keeping food is difficult at this time, Biljana is always optimistic and smiling. She is requesting the loan to renovate their toilette and complete some renovations in the house. The loan will improve her family's living conditions. Her goal is to give her children better education. She promises she will repay the loan on time. She is very grateful to the KIVA lenders for improving her family’s conditions and contributing to her children’s overall health.

loans.use: To renovate toilette and house

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 24-year-old man. He is a worker who gets a low income which is not enough to cover his needs and pay his expenses. 

Mahmoud is engaged and planning to get married soon, so he is preparing to complete his house. But, due to a money shortage, some work has been stopped for a while. 

As a result, Mahmoud is requesting a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to continue finishing his house, completing work such as installing tiles and painting. 

Taking this loan will offer to Mahmoud and his future wife comfortable and suitable home conditions, so they can enjoy living in their house. Mahmoud is photographed inside his house.

loans.use: to complete the house that he and his future wife will live in.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon is 28 years old, married, and supports a family of three. She runs beauty salon in Eldama Ravine, which she has been doing for four years. She earns an average monthly income of 45,000 KES. 

Sharon is requesting her second loan for 60,000 KES, which she will use to purchase cosmetics and other items for her salon. She anticipates earning profits, which she will use to expand her business by increasing the items she sells to meet her clients' demand.  Sharon hopes to improve her living standards and be financially stable; she also hopes to save money to enable her to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase beer and soda to sell.

loans.name: Mohira

texts.ru: Мохира женщина с прекрасной душой и прекрасными мыслями. Она разведена и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Судьба у этой прекрасной женщины очень тяжелая, так как  муж бросил ее и женился на другой. Мохира осталась с 1 ребенком. Благодаря родителям, она получила высшее образование и более 13 лет она работает учительницей в средней школе. Она любит свою работу и работает с удовольствием. Ее ученики любят и уважают ее. Мохира получает маленькую зарплату и ели-ели справляется с расходами. Трудное условие проживания повлияло на ее здоровье. Мохира серьезно больна. Она должна срочно лечь в больницу, но не имеет средства для этого. Если ее здоровье ухудшится, от она не может работать и ее ребенок останется без кормильца. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2000 сомони для лечения. Она ждет и надеется только на вас.
texts.en:
Mohira is a woman with a wonderful heart and beautiful thoughts.  She is divorced and has one child.  Fate has not been kind to this wonderful woman.  Her husband left her and married someone else.  Mohira was left with the child.   Thanks to her parents, she received a higher education and for more than 13 years she has been working as a high school teacher.  She loves her job and works with pleasure.  Her students love and respect her.  Mohira earns a small salary and can just barely make ends meet.  

The difficult conditions of her life have taken a toll on her health.  Mohira is serioulsy ill.  She needs to go to the hospital, but she doesn't have the means to afford this.  If her health worsens, she won't be able to work and her child will be left without a breadwinner.  She is requesting a loan of 2,000 somoni for treatment.  She depends and relies only on you.

loans.use: to pay for treatment

loans.name: Sayomudin

texts.ru: Саёмудин житель города Вахдат. Ему 54 года. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Саёмудин работает таксистом. В этой области он 7 лет. Саёмудин берет кредит для приобретения нового автомобиля. Так как он уже несколько лет предоставляет услугу на имеющейся автомашине.
texts.en: Sayomudin lives in the city of Vahdat.  He is 54 years old and is married with one child.  Sayomudin works as a taxi driver and he has been in this business for seven years.  He is asking for a loan to buy a new car, as he has been using his current car as a taxi for a few years.

loans.use: to buy a new car.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
This is Antonina. She previously received a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more vegetables. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in her family's personal, household, and business expenditures. 

Antonina would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to purchase more vegetables needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and her children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Antonina dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high-quality education and hopes that her business will grow. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of vegetables needed in her business

loans.name: Babulia

texts.en: Babulia lives in Georgia's Kaspi district. She is 54 years old and shares her home with a daughter and a son. Both of her children work for small monthly salaries, her daughter as a nurse. Babulia earns a living by running a small dairy farm with two milk cows, whose milk she uses to make cheese which she sells at the local open market. She works hard to set aside some savings and improve the living conditions of her family. Babulia is requesting this loan to buy an additional cow so that she can produce and sell more cheese, and earn a greater profit. She will use these profits to invest in her business and provide her family with a better life.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: Justus is a 39-year-old married man with five children who lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. From buying and selling produce, like maize and beans, he earned enough money to start a bar. With the income that he earns, he is able to look after his family. He also does some farming to supplement his income from the business. His main customers are his neighbors in the village but his dream is to move to town centers where he expects to have many customers with business very profitable. Justus is requesting a loan to buy beer and soda to sell in his bar.

loans.use: to buy beer and soda to sell in his bar.

loans.name: Goran

texts.en:
Goran is 37 years old, married and a father of two children, 1 and 5. They all live in a vulnerable community. For more than 10 years Goran has worked as a painter, painting the houses of others. His work is in demand and now  he has expanded his painting business to technical construction and insulation work. 
He is a very hard-working man who wants to improve his family's condition. He serves all nationalities that live in Kosovo regardless of ethnicity or religion. Goran now is in need of a loan to buy materials for insulation and tools for his work. This loan will help him to raise his income. He hopes in the future to hire another employee to help him because he can’t meet a lot of demands working by himself.  
His goal is to increase his budget. He wants to thank all Kiva lenders for this support!

loans.use: To buy materials for insulation and tools for his work

loans.name: Evasi

texts.en: Evasi is a 36-year-old single mother of four children living in Masindi, Uganda .She sells vegetables and, with the income earned, she has been able to provide basics for her family. The sole responsibility for her family rests on her ever since she separated from her husband. The high rate of produce perishability causes her losses. She desires to use modern preservative methods and also to diversify her business to include cereals. Evasi intends to use the loan to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is a 64-year-old widow and has three children. 

Anecita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Anecita requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Anecita has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Anecita would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
This is Mariam, She previously accessed a 13,000 PHP loan to buy more quantities of products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings for her food stall business Her earnings were a big help toward meeting her personal, household and business expenses. 

She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan  to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Mariam dreams of growing her business in the future and hopes to have a bright future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables needed in her business.

loans.name: Akaki

texts.en:
Akaki, 28 years old, lives with his parents in Khoni district, West Georgia. His father receives a retirement pension, and the family runs an agricultural business comprised of three milk cows, two buffalo, five pigs and six bee colonies. His mother produces cheese which she sells at a good price in a local open market. As well, they have a 0.7 hectare plot of land upon which they grow maize and haricots, both also sold locally.

Akaki is a very hardworking man who does all the work connected with the honey business, selling the product locally at a good price. He has requested a loan to purchase beehives in order to expand the business. The resulting increased income will improve the family's living conditions. Akaki awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase beehives.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: La tienda de Rosa con su anterior credikiva, se vio mucho mas surtida y con mas clientes visitándola, porque logró comprar y exhibir víveres, ranchos, bebidas y muchos de los productos que mas rotan diariamente. Así mismo compró mercancía variada que había promocionado, mediante su guía especializada y que vendió fácilmente, pues sus clientes encontraron los productos que buscaban, a precios  que traían descuentos especiales. Hoy está planeando recibir un credikiva con el cual surtirá nuevamente su tienda con productos de la canasta familiar e invertirá especialmente en cervezas, para responder a la temporada de fiestas que se acerca. Su mensaje a los finacadores de Kiva es el siguiente : "Agradezco enormemente la ayuda recibida y deseo que este modelo lo puedan aplicar en todo el territorio nacional."
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan Rosa saw her store better stocked and with more customers visiting because she managed to buy and display supplies, food, beverages, and many of the products that turn over most every day.  She also bought a variety of merchandise that she had promoted from her specialized catalog.  It sold quickly because her customers found what they were looking for at specially discounted prices.

Now she's planning to get a Kiva loan to supply her store again with products from the family shopping basket.  She'll invest in beer in particular, to respond to the coming party season.

Her message to Kiva lenders is this: "I'm enormously grateful for the help received and I hope you can use this model throughout the country."

loans.use: to buy products from the family shopping basket and beer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies, as well as organic, insecticide and fertilizers for growing corn.

loans.name: Jose Agustin

texts.es:
José Agustina tiene 54 años es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos. Vive en el Recinto Aguas frías de Mocache, Cantón Mocache.

Ventanilla EL PROGRESO  se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto Aguas Frías de Mocahe, perteneciente al cantón Mocache, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.

José Agustín  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra y vende los productos en Mocache.

El crédito lo solicita para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, urea, insecticidas, abonos orgànicos para los cultivos. El préstamo le ayudado a aumentar los ingresos para bienestar de la familia. El sueño es comprar un terreno. Los desafìos a los que se enfrenta aon las plagas en el maìz y el arroz. En el tiempo libre le gusta  practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
José Agustina, 54, is married and lives with his wife and children. He lives in Aguas Frías de Mocache rural community in the Mocache Canton.
The communal bank EL PROGRESO is located in the same community and belongs to the Mocache Canton. Its members are short-cycle crop farmers who grow corn and rice.

José Agustín is a farmer who grows corn and rice. He buys supplies in Mocache and sells his produce at the market in Mocache.

He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, urea, insecticide and compost for his crops. The loan will help him increase his income to provide for his family. His dream is to buy land. The challenges he faces are plagues that affect his corn and rice crops.

He enjoys playing sports in his free time.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers, urea, insecticide and compost.

loans.name: Nilsa Magola

texts.es: Nilsa de 44 años de edad es la propietaria de un taller de confecciones ubicado en su domicilio  donde vive con su cónyuge y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 12 y 17 años. Ella tiene un experiencia de 3 años en el oficio de confección y antes de iniciar su negocio, justamente un año después de conocer el oficio, trabajó como jefe de la sección de hogar en una cadena de almacenes. Nilsa aprendió a confeccionar de manera autodidacta,  fabricando edredones, cubrelechos y juegos de cama que vendía inicialmente a los más cercanos a ella y gradualmente ganó un mercado con el cual ha ido creciendo. Sus actividad comercial las realiza principalmente a crédito y algunas de contado y en su negocio trabajan día a día, desde las 8 de la mañana, hasta las 6 de la tarde. Pues tiene como meta incrementar sus ventas, para generar mayores utilidades, pues planea educar a sus hijos  con mucha calidad, para potencializar su éxito futuro. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará una fileteadora y materia prima en mayor volumen, porque necesita mejorar sus tiempos productivos, darle un mejor acabado a sus productos y no gastar en este servicio cuando lo requiere, como usualmente lo que hace. Con esta inversión asegurará su éxito en el aumento de una clientela menos doméstica y más institucional.
texts.en:
Nilsa, 44, has a sewing workshop in her house, where she lives with her husband and two children, ages 12 and 17. She has three years experience as a seamstress. Before starting her business just a year after learning this trade, she was the manager of the housewares department for a chain store. Nilsa taught herself sewing by making quilts, bedspreads, and sheet sets that she initially sold to friends and family. She began to see a larger, growing  market, and she now works daily from 8 am until 6 pm and sells for cash and on credit. 

Nilsa wants to grow her business and increase her income so that she can offer her children a quality education and a bright future. She is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to buy an overlock sewing machine and wholesale fabric. She must become more efficient and make a better finished product. She must invest in her service when needed, and this investment will assure that she increases her commercial clientele and relies less on family and friends as customers.

loans.use: to buy an overlock sewing machine and wholesale fabric.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es: Ruben, tiene la edad  de 28 años, está casado, vive con su esposa e hijo  que son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas y pagar mano de otra en trabajos de asistencia para el café. Además de poder comprar unas plantas de almácigo para realizar resiembras y así aumentar la densidad de plantas por área, además de aprovechar la buena fertilidad del suelo y las condiciones de clima y otras que favorecen al cultivo de café. Con estas mejoras al cultivo espera obtener un poco de ganancias y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y también invertir un poco más en el área de cultivo y también cumplir algunas metas.  Es el segundo  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Ruben is twenty-eight years old and is married.  He lives with his wife and son; they are his top priority.  

With his loan, he will buy fertilizers, fungicide, and pay laborers to help with the coffee.  He will also be able to buy seedling plants in order to replant and thereby increase the plant density in the area.  He will be able to furthermore take advantage of the fertile ground, climate, and other conditions that favor the cultivation of coffee.  

With these improvements to his crop, he hopes to obtain profits and thereby improve the life conditions of his family.  He also hopes to invest a bit more in his crop land and to also meet some of his goals.  

This is the second loan he has received through FUDECOSUR.  He had not had other loans previously in state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered him a loan with greater ease and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to attend to his coffee plantation in buying fertilizers, fungicide, and paying day laborers.

loans.name: Benter

texts.en: Benter is 32 years old and earns a living by running a food cafe in Mishomuhoroni, Mombasa. She is married and has helped support her family for the last year by running this business, which is doing very well. She is requesting a loan to buy more food to sell in her kiosk, including beans, bales of wheat flour, and cooking fat. She will use the additional income she earns from this loan to provide her family with a better life and make repayments. This is her second loan; she repaid her first successfully. She hopes to live a successful life.

loans.use: to buy food items such as beans, bales of wheat flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en: Zeinabis is 39 years old and lives in Georgia's Kaspi district with her husband and 18-year-old son. The family earns a living by running a small dairy farm with four milk cows whose milk they use to make cheese products which they sell at the local open market. She works hard to earn enough money to set aside some savings and improve the living conditions of her family. Zeinab is requesting this loan to buy an additional milk cow because this will allow her to produce and sell more cheese. She will use the additional profits she earns to invest in her business, meet her family's needs, and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Bertha de 74 años de edad, es una mujer carismática, emprendedora con ganas de superación, además de ser muy amable y social. Es separada, ella se dedica a la actividad de costura. Es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales ya son independientes. Vive en su casa propia lo cual logro construir con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Bertha es la costura, cose ropas para damas caballeros y niños para toda ocasión, promociones,  quince años, escolares y otros, lo cual lo realiza en su casa propia en un ambiente bien equipado con máquinas de coser y muebles, donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes. Trabaja en una empresa privada medio tiempo y por las tardes realiza la actividad de costura.
Se inició con esta actividad ya que aprendió al ver como cosía su madre y notando que es rentable. Cuando empezó, solo tenía una máquina que compró con un préstamo de MFP, ahora está bien implementada. Esta actividad lo realiza sola.
Nos comenta que esta actividad  lo considera rentable porque le da un buen ingreso económico. Le  dio  una buena educación a sus hijos y comodidad. Puede pagar los gastos de su casa. Antes de empezar con este negocio su sueldo no le alcanzaba. Espera seguir creciendo y comprar nuevas máquinas y ampliar su negocio. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 07 con la institución MFP, está muy contenta de poder contar con el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo, ya que así avanzara con su negocio y se convertirá en una gran empresaria. Por otro lado nos comenta que está muy contenta por ser parte de un grupo responsable.
Con el préstamo solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles comprará materiales de costura como telas, elásticos entre otros  para implementar su negocio y atender los pedidos que tiene por entregar, todos estos materiales los traerá desde la capital buscando conseguir precios más cómodos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en: Seventy-four year-old Bertha is, as well as being both friendly and sociable, a charismatic and entrepreneurial woman with a will to succeed.  She is separated, and has three children who are now independent, and she works as a seamstress.  She lives in her own house that, with a huge effort, she managed to build.  As a seamstress, Bertha makes clothes for men, women and children for all occasions: graduations, important birthday celebrations, school events and other occasions.  She works in her own house, in a well-equipped room that has sewing machines and furniture.  It is here that she tends to her customers in a very friendly manner.  She works for a private company part time and as a seamstress in the afternoons.  She started this work when she saw her mother sew and realised that it could be profitable.  When she started, she had only one machine that she bought with an MFP loan and now her business is well under way.  She works alone.  She says that she thinks the work is profitable because it is generating a good income.  She provided her children with a good education and looked after them well.  She is able to pay her household bills but before starting this business, she did not have enough to do this.  She hopes to continue prospering, buy new machines and expand the business.  This, then, will be her seventh loan from MF and she is very happy to be able to count on the financial support that she receives, because this is what helped her business progress and what made her a businesswoman.  She has said that she is glad to be part of such a responsible group.  With the request for a loan of 1200 Nuevo Soles, Bertha will buy sewing materials such as material and elastic, among other things, to put into her business and to fulfill orders that she has taken.  She will buy all her materials in Lima where prices are cheaper when buying in bulk.

loans.use: to buy material and elastic, among other things, for her business.

texts.es: Ingrid compró cajas de cervezas con las que surtió su punto frio y vendió, aumentando su utilidad con ese nuevo capital de trabajo. Hoy se prepara para la época decembrina y requiere tener mucho más surtido su negocio, por eso acude a un credikiva, pues ante la demanda potencial de estos productos, su dinero se torna insuficiente para responder a su mercado y distribuir entre las unidades de negocios,  que no tengan suficientes productos,  cuando lleguen las fiestas. Con su nuevo credikiva planea comprar un mayor volumen de cervezas, y vender no solo al detal sino también al por mayor. Su inversión del credikiva será exitosa porque la aplica ajustada a la demanda de la época, conoce su mercado y tiene compradores reales que ya le han encargado refrescos y cervezas.  Ella con su negocio está muy satisfecha porque ha crecido con los financiamientos y su trabajo efectivo, mejorando la calidad de vida de si misma y de sus hijos. En su mensaje a los financiadores dice agradece que le hayan prestado el dinero para trabajar mejor  y a un bajo costo.
texts.en:
Ingrid bought boxes of beers which she chilled and sold, increasing her working capital. Today, she is preparing for the holiday season and requires much more stock for her business. For this reason, she is turning to Kiva before the demand for these products increases, and she does not have sufficient funds or time to get more product during the holidays.

With her new Kiva loan, she plans to buy a large volume of beers and sell not only at retail, but also wholesale. Your investment to Kiva will be successful because she is adjusting to seasonal demand, knows the market, and has real buyers that have already commissioned soft drinks and beers.

She is very satisfied with her business because it has grown with the financing and her hard work, improving the quality of life for her and her children. In her message to the financiers, she said she appreciates that they have lent money for her to work better at such a low cost.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
18 mujeres de la ciudad de Luque se unieron con el propósito de ayudar a sus familias por medio del trabajo en equipo, vieron una gran oportunidad en el programa de la fundación paraguaya, y quieren poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa. Hoy se encuentran en su ciclo numero 2.
La Sra. Claudia es integrante de comité, tiene 29 años, está casada con el Sr. Derlis, quien es chofer, juntos tienen 1 hijo. Ella es vendedora de prendas de todo tipo, y con ello ayuda a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. El crédito lo solicita para comprar  ropas, blusas, remeras, artículos de mercería, para poderlas vender y así seguir ganándose su sustento.
texts.en:
Eighteen women from the city of Luque have joined together with the goal of helping their families. By working as a team, they plan to take advantage of this great opportunity provided by the program with Fundación Paraguaya. They want to reach the highest level of the program. At the moment, they are in their second loan cycle.

Sra. Claudia is a member of this committee. She is 29 years old and married to Sr. Derlis, who works as a chauffeur. They have one child. Claudia sells clothing of all types and her husband helps with the household expenses. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy clothing, blouses, T-shirts, and sewing supplies to sell. As a result, she can continue earning income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing, blouses, T-shirts, and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Kiyal

texts.ru:
Кыял получает кредит по КИВА 2 раз. Предыдущий кредит в размере 35,000 KGS, оплачен во время и полностью.
Кыял 36 лет, воспитывает двух детей. В 2004 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Кыял начала свой бизнес в торговле овощами со стартовой суммой в 2,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости и упорному труду, Кыял сумела развить свой бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в 15,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день ассортимент товаров не представлен в изобилии, и по этой причине Кыял обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS). Доходы от кредита Кыял планирует частично вложить в закуп стройматериалов для ремонта дома, и обучить детей.
texts.en: Kiyal is applying for her second Kiva loan.  Her first loan for 35,000 KGS was paid in full and on time.  Kiyal is 36 years old and has two children at home.  In 2004, while searching for a source of income for her family, Kiyal started her business selling vegetables with the starting sum of 2,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her perseverance and hard work, she was able to increase her monthly income to 15,000 som (KGS).  She doesn't have a large stock of products at this time, which is why she has turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  Kiyal plans on spending part of the proceeds from her loan on building materials to repair her home, and part to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to increase her variety of goods on offer.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo is a widow who is 32 years old. She earns a living by selling various items and likes to keep her business well stocked. She works very hard and leaves no stone unturned to win new customers. Although she faces many challenges, she has decided to expand her business. She is requesting a loan for KSH. 30,000 to buy bales of wheat and maize flour, detergents, snacks and other items to sell. She is grateful for your help.

loans.use: to buy bales of wheat and maize flour, detergents, snacks and other items.

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
Cecil is married and has four children. She has a general store in the Philippines.

Cecil is requesting a loan through NWTF for 4,600 PHP, which she will use to buy a solar lamp to save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses. She is aware that by using the solar lamp she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase a solar lamp

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy salon products such as synthetic hair, cosmetics and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is 30 years old, married, and has two children. He is a construction worker and earns a low salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs.

Saleh is requesting a loan from FATEN, which he will use to help him cover the cost of purchasing new living room furniture in order to improve living conditions in his house. Taking this loan will offer to Saleh and his family comfortable furniture so they can enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to purchase new home furniture.

loans.name: Al-Byan Group

texts.en:
This group, called Al-Byan, consists of five ladies and one man who live in Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 180,000 YER.

Sabah is a 28-year-old married woman who has four children from Taiz, Yemen. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 YER to buy a washing machine. In the future she hopes to improve her family's living standard, buy new furniture, do maintenance on her home, and buy a car.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.es:
La señora Ninfa es costurera, elabora juego de sabanas; vive en casa propia con un acabado fino y piso de machimbre, su vivienda está ubicada en  la zona de Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz.
Ninfa elabora juego de sabanas, del cual genera sus ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, luz, agua;  el crédito lo  requiere para la compra de materia prima: comprará tela, encaje, hilo, para mejorar su ingresos y su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Ninfa es tener un taller de costura.
Es la tercera vez con IMPRO y la tercera con Kiva.
texts.en: Nina’s a seamstress; she manufactures bed linen sets.  She lives in her own house with fine finishing touches and wood flooring; the house is located in the city of La Paz’s Irpavi zone.
